subject: We Must Restore the Voting Rights Act
email_content: Protect voters in time for Election Day 2016  Sign the Petition Now:We must strengthen the Voting Rights Act before Election Day.ADD YOUR NAME    Dear Activist,We are weeks away from the presidential election and our most effective tool for protecting voters has been weakened.Please join me in urging Congress to hold a hearing on restoring the Voting Rights Act of 1965 VRA to its full power right away  .This year marks the 51st anniversary of the VRA, one of the most important and effective civil rights laws ever passed. But in the wake of the Supreme Court's 2013 Shelby County decision, which gutted Section 5 of the VRA, a wave of discriminatory voting changes have been unleashed on communities of color, affecting millions of voters.In fact, this will be the first presidential election in more than half a century without the full protections of the Voting Rights Act in place.The NAACP Legal Defense and Educational Fund LDF is a nonpartisan, nonprofit 501c3 organization that has been at the forefront of civil rights litigation and advocacy for over 75 years. LDF has aggressively challenged barriers to voting in court, but without the full protections of the VRA, discriminatory legislation will keep coming up.Senate Judiciary Committee Chairman Chuck Grassley and House Judiciary Committee Chairman Bob Goodlatte have the power to hold a hearing right now about restoring these protections.Help us send a strong message that we will not stand by as millions of voters are stripped of their democratic right to vote. Sign the petition now  .Onward,Sherrilyn A. IfillPresident and Director-CounselIf you wish to stop receiving our emails or change your subscription options, please visit this link: Box 1452, New York, NY 10276

subject: Ballots dropping [need help from 98208]
email_content: Ballots start dropping.Dear Friend,Ballots have started dropping across Washington. We're now in the final weeks leading up to Election Day -- this is the moment we've been preparing for.Voters are now deciding. For governor, they have a clear choice. They can vote for Jay and his optimistic, progressive vision for Washington -- or his opponent's dire and pessimistic outlook.But make no mistake -- along with the choice between Jay and his opponent, voters are making a big decision about the kind of state we want to live in: one based on progressive values or one that turns backward on our progress.That's why it's essential we work non-stop over the next couple weeks to re-elect Jay Inslee as governor, and make sure Democrats fill in their ballots and return them by Tuesday, November 8th. Right Now: We're looking for 14 supporters in your zip who can make a quick donation to support our grassroots efforts reaching voters over the next 18 days. Can you help?  This election is a choice between economic justice, sustainable growth, great schools, combatting climate change, and keeping Washington open for business -- or stepping back to Republican trickle down policies benefiting only a few. We cannot leave anything on the table. It must be a concerted push to get ballots completed and returned. The direction of our state depends on each of us doing all we can between now and Election Day.Step up today at jayinslee.com/GetOutTheVote.Thank you for your help,Aisling KerinsCampaign Director CONTRIBUTE:  This email was sent to . subject: Keep the Lame Duck's appetite in check
email_content: Web Version:   Peter-As Americans across the country are still recovering from their Thanksgiving feasts, our Lame Duck Congress is preparing to fill its never-ending appetite for overspending.This Lame Duck Congress, full of lawmakers who will soon be retiring or leaving their posts after losing reelection, lacks the accountability to the people that's inherent in a normal session of Congress. It's not the time to commit to a giant, long-term spending bill, but that's exactly what many lawmakers will try to do.Instead, lawmakers should focus on passing a clean spending bill that extends to early 2017, when we will have a Congress that is fully accountable and capable of fulfilling the will of the people.We need to  pressure our lawmakers  to not use this Lame Duck session as an opportunity for more overspending and corporate welfare giveaways at the expense of the taxpayer.  By clicking above, you can tell your members of Congress to do the right thing. -Americans for ProsperityThis email was sent to:      We respect your right to privacy - view our policy Americans For Prosperity Foundation 1310 N. subject: Forming the resistance
email_content: Sisters and Brothers -If Donald Trump had his way, he'd make discrimination the law of the land.During his campaign he supported banning all Muslims from entering the U.S., and last week he defended his plan to create a national registry of Muslims who live here.Trump has said he wants to deport millions of undocumented immigrants who call this country home. And he plans to reverse President Obama's executive action that provides relief for people like me who were brought to the U.S. as children.Trump also wants to expand the use of stop-and-frisk, a practice that is essentially an open invitation for police officers to racially profile people of color.We must do everything we can to protect communities that will be targeted by the racist and xenophobic Trump administration. That's why one of Our Revolution's top priorities in 2017 will be defending the rights of those who will be most vulnerable during Trump's presidency.Will you make a $3 contribution before tonight's end-of-year fundraising deadline to support Our Revolution's work protecting immigrants, Muslims, and anyone else who becomes a target under Trump? Revolution will be working at the state and local level to implement policies to keep immigrant families together, establish fair policing practices and allow all people to feel safe in their communities.When Trump tries to divide us and force millions of our sisters and brothers to live in fear, it will be up to us to stand up for and defend the rights of those who will be harmed by the policies of his administration.Sanctuary cities and states - places that protect undocumented immigrants from deportation - will be a central focus of our work. By working with grassroots organizations, we will ensure the existing protections granted by sanctuaries are kept in place while adopting those same protections in other cities and states across the country.Will you make a $3 contribution right now, ahead of tonight's end-of-year fundraising deadline, to help Our Revolution form the resistance movement against Trump? contribution we receive will send a powerful message that our movement is prepared to fight back against Trump's destructive plans for our country.Thank you for adding yours before tonight's midnight deadline.In solidarity,Erika AndiolaPolitical DirectorOur Revolution-----Paid for by Our RevolutionNOT AUTHORIZED BY ANY CANDIDATE OR CANDIDATE COMMITTEE. subject: what we know
email_content: Friend --The last 24 hours have raised serious national security concerns -- and this is just the beginning.Not only have we learned more about Michael Flynn's secret contacts with Russia, but we also learned that Donald Trump was aware his National Security Advisor was lying and he still chose not to act. At least, not until it became a PR problem.This is a time to put country before politics. Nothing less than the national security of this country is at stake.It's time for Republicans to stand aside and support a full investigation into the Trump team's ties to Russia. Will you join us in calling for an independent investigation?ADD YOUR NAME:  truth is, Michael Flynn's resignation raises more questions than it answers.Did this Trump loyalist really go rogue and reach out to the Russians to discuss U.S. sanctions without consulting his superiors?Did Russia really believe General Flynn had full authority to speak for the Trump administration? Or was Moscow in contact with other Trump officials?After the Justice Department warned the White House three weeks ago that Flynn could be compromised by a foreign power, how could other officials remain in the dark about Flynn's conversations with Russia?And most importantly, what did President Trump know and when did he know it?Friend, will you add your name to stand with Senate Democrats who are calling for an independent investigation into Trump's connections with Russia?ADD YOUR NAME:                               At a minimum, this affair shows that the White House chain of command is alarmingly unprepared to guard our national security. But darker still, it raises the possibility that Flynn is a scapegoat who resigned to protect others who were fully aware of his actions.In either case, the American people deserve immediate action to know.Will you add your name to stand with us? you for standing up for our democracy,Chris Van HollenDSCC ChairDemocratic Senatorial Campaign Committee120 Maryland Ave. NEWashington, DC 20002Paid for by DSCC, dscc.org,and not authorized by any candidate or candidate's committee.The DSCC is the only committee solely dedicated to supporting Democrats in the U.S. Senate. subject: DEADLINE: Joe needs your help, Peter!
email_content: "Indiana's Senate race is expected to be one of the top targets for Republicans because Donnelly is the only Democrat elected statewide in Indiana, which voted for President Trump by nearly 20 percentage points." - USA Today, 4/10/17Peter -- We all know that Indiana is at the top of Mitch McConnell and Donald Trump's list of must-win Senate races. The math is simple: Republicans need to get to a filibuster-proof, 60-seat Senate majority in order to ram through their radical right-wing agenda. They can't get to 60 if they don't knock out Joe.That means that Joe Donnelly is standing in the way of the Trump/McConnell agenda. And that's where you come in.Joe is facing a $35,000 fundraising deadline by the end of the month. subject: re: Trump's shutdown threat
email_content: @realDonaldTrump said:The reason for the plan negotiated between the Republicans and Democrats is that we need 60 votes in the Senate which are not there! We...@realDonaldTrump said:either elect more Republican Senators in 2018 or change the rules now to 51%. Our country need a good "shutdown" in September to fix mess! is the world we are living in. Yesterday, our president said our country needs a shutdown. And I am outraged.Does President Trump understand what a government shutdown would mean? Because I'll tell you right now: Thousands of government employees would go without wages. Children will be turned away from their field trips to hundreds of national parks, museums, and zoos. Government loans to businesses could be delayed.And why doesn't President Trump think about that? Because he doesn't think about working people. He thinks about his wealthy friends who won't be affected. But we can't let him get away with doing real damage to real people's lives.A government shutdown is not a tool to further Republicans' agenda. It is the result of the GOP choosing to play politics over settling on a budget that will help American families. But President Trump thinks that their inability to create an acceptable budget is a reason to elect more Republicans to the Senate.You know what I think? subject: Next Level Roads / Congress of Counties Survey / Health Care Update
email_content: Next Level Roads / Congress of Counties SurveyGovernor Eric Holcomb launched Indiana's Next Level Roads Plan this week. The $4.7 billion, 5-year plan will upgrade thousands of miles of Hoosier highways and roads, and there's more to come thanks to the 20-year plan passed during our latest legislative session. You can learn more about the announcement and see exactly which roads are on the list below.In addition, I want to personally ask you to participate in a short survey  we created to help us plan for this year's Congress of Counties. Historically held in odd-numbered years, Congress of Counties is a two-day training held to equip our top activists, volunteers and leaders with the tools and technology they need to succeed. To make this year's event the best yet, we need to hear from you  !Please take a few moments to share your thoughts  on where Congress of Counties should be held and what should be included in the programming so we can better prepare for an enjoyable and informative weekend this fall.Don't forget Governor Holcomb's Sporting Clay Shoot  with First Lady Janet Holcomb & Colts Kicker Adam Vinatieri taking place on Tuesday! For more information, contact Zach Willis at zachwillis@holcombforindiana.com. This event benefits Team Holcomb, the joint fundraising committee for the Indiana Republican Party and Eric Holcomb for Indiana.- KyleGovernor Holcomb's Week That WasAs mentioned above, Governor Holcomb put tires to pavement this week as he made stops in Indianapolis  , Lafayette  , Terre Haute  , Evansville  and Sellerburg  - with extra stops in Covington  and Bruceville  - to unveil Indiana's Next Level Roads Plan  ! The first 5 years of our 20-year infrastructure plan will invest $4.7 billion on Indiana's roads and bridges. A total of 122 lane miles will be added, 9,628 lane miles will be resurfaced and 1,295 bridges will be rehabbed or replaced. In addition to scheduled work on state roads, theplan calls for an additional $342 million annually to be invested in local city, county and town infrastructure.This long-term, sustainable, data-driven infrastructure plan is fully funded and will maintain Indiana's position as the Crossroads of America for generations to come.Find out which projects are coming to your county by checking out the full Next Level Roads Plan here.  Series Application Deadline Fast ApproachingThe deadline to apply for Indiana's premiere women's leadership training program is August 1st!The Richard G. Lugar Excellence in Public Service Series aims to enhance and expand engagement in politics, government and/or business and non-profit life. Don't miss out on the chance to learn from the best and the brightest and the opportunity to become part of a growing family of alumni that includes former Lt. Governor Sue Ellspermann, Treasurer Kelly Mitchell, State Rep. & State Party Secretary Holli Sullivan and our nation's CMS Administrator Seema Verma. Click here to apply  .Health Care UpdateSenate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell unveiled the latest version of the Better Care Reconciliation Act on Thursday. As Senator McConnell and others said, the initial bill was a 'discussion draft' and this revamped legislation includes some important provisions that have been included based on those discussions. These additions include:More Help to Cover Out-of-Pocket Costs: An additional $70 billion is dedicated to encouraging state-based reforms, which could include help with driving down premiums through cost-sharing, Health Savings Accounts HSA, and other innovative ideas to help pay for health care costs. This is in addition to the $112 billion in funding already in the original bill.Health Savings Accounts to Pay for Premiums: In order to ensure that more people have financial support to pay for health care costs, a provision has been included in the bill that would, for the first time, allow people to use their HSAs to pay for their premiums.  This is a policy that both the Joint Committee on Taxation JCT and the Congressional Budget Office CBO say will increase health care coverage.Additional Resources to Combat the Opioid Epidemic: With the opioid crisis hitting Americans in every state, an additional $45 billion is dedicated for substance abuse treatment and recovery.News You Can UseSecretary of State Connie Lawson assumes presidency of National Association of Secretaries of State  Kelly Mitchell helps Indiana Diary at their Ice Cream Social on the Circle  Todd Young highlights Indiana's incredible work fighting human trafficking  Jackie Walorski says small businesses need tax reform  Jim Banks speaks about 'urgent and imminent threat' posed by North Korea  Todd Rokita calls on Congress to postpone August Recess  Susan Brooks' weekly #WhatImHearing video on the opioid crisis  Luke Messer proposal to help vets impacted by ITT Tech closure one step closer to law  Larry Bucshon discusses the drug epidemic on the House Floor  Trey Hollingsworth posts photos from his District Work Week travel  CalendarSaturday, July 15  - Fayette County GOP Hog Roast/BBQSaturday, August 5  - Annual Buck Garden PartyFriday, August 11  - IFRW Tribute to Women DinnerSaturday, August 12  - IFRW State ConventionThursday, August 17  - Perry-Spencer Republican PicnicSaturday, August 19  - Adams County 2nd Annual Benjamin Harrison BreakfastSaturday, August 19  - Clay County GOP Handgun Raffle & Pie AuctionSaturday, August 19  - Grillin' & Chillin' at the Brown County GOP BBQFriday, August 25  - Grant County GOP Golf Scramble============================================================**   Share    Tweet    Forward      mailto:info@indiana.gopThis email was sent to  mailto:why did I get this?      unsubscribe from this list      update subscription preferences  Republican State Committee, Inc. . 101 W. subject: A Message From The President
email_content: 1600 Daily  A Message From The President Yesterday, I met with Republican Senators at the White House and told them that now is the time for action. Obamacare was a big lie. “You can keep your doctor”—lie. “You can keep your plan”—lie. Now, people are hurting, and inaction is not an option. We must repeal and replace this disaster. The Senate should not leave for summer recess until it has passed a plan to give our people great healthcare. I’m ready to act; I have pen in hand. I’ll sign the legislation into law, and then we can celebrate for the American people.- President Donald J. Trump ------------- President Trump Hosts Made in America Roundtable with American Companies Yesterday, President Trump hosted a Made in America Roundtable with 20 American companies and 4 members of Congress. The discussions were focused on the importance of manufacturing products in American factories with American workers. Read More President Trump Discusses Healthcare Plan with Members of CongressPresident Trump hosted a lunch with members of Congress to discuss the problems with healthcare and to urge not only the repeal, but also the replacement of the disaster known as Obamacare. President Trump's new plan for healthcare will substantially lower premiums, repeal burdensome taxes, expand coverage options, protect preexisting condition coverage, improve medical outcomes for low income Americans, and redirect authority from Washington D.C. to the states so they can innovate and develop the best practices for the American people. Watch the Discussion Vice President Pence Leads First Meeting of the Presidential Advisory Commission on Election IntegrityYesterday, Vice President Pence was joined by several elected officials at the first meeting of the Presidential Advisory Commission on Election Integrity, which is designed to explore and fix vulnerabilities in the voting process to ensure the integrity of our system. subject: My birthday
email_content: Team --Thirty-eight years ago today, I was born to my mother Frances, a bus driver, and my daddy Charles, a construction worker in Miami, Florida.They didn't know that their son would go on to become the youngest City Commissioner in Tallahassee's history. Or that he'd later become Mayor. Or that he'd run for Governor.All they knew was that they loved me, and they wanted to give me the best opportunities they could. They didn't give me a famous last name or millions of dollars in wealth. They gave me love -- and a chance.Today, I'm running to become Governor of Florida to honor what my parents gave me on my first birthday - a chance to do well and get ahead.And I've tried to take that chance whenever it's presented itself.When I was in the 7th grade, I didn't think I belonged in honors classes at Westwood Middle School in Gainesville. My language arts teacher, Ms. Alexandria, encouraged me to sign up for them, but I wasn't sure I belonged. None of my older siblings had ever graduated from high school, let alone taken an honors class. But she insisted -- and ultimately persisted -- in getting me to take that chance.When I first ran for City Commission, the cynics and critics told me I was too young and too inexperienced. That I needed to wait my turn and one day they might decide it was my turn. But all I asked for in that campaign was a chance - and the wonderful people of Tallahassee granted me one.And today - on my birthday - all I'm asking for is a chance.A chance to help change Florida for the better. A chance to help working families in every corner of our state make ends meet. A chance for every person to have access to a job with dignity. A chance for every person to have access to affordable and quality healthcare as a right. A chance to help every student get a high-quality public education.Will you help give me this chance to serve the state of Florida by chipping in to our campaign for Governor today?  we continue on this journey, I hope you'll join me so we can give every Floridian the opportunity they need to succeed and live a fulfilled life - no matter your race, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, class, age, ability, or background.So as I celebrate my birthday today, I want you to help me give every Floridian what I got on my first birthday - a real chance.Bring it home,Andrew----This email was sent to .To unsubscribe, go to:

subject: five alarm fire
email_content: Friend,Last week we witnessed another torrent of alarming developments from President Trump and his White House. We saw more outrageous White House staff turmoil, inappropriate Presidential remarks to the Boy Scouts, the New York Police, and on Twitter, and little evidence that anyone at 1600 Pennsylvania Avenue is adequately focused on the very real threats facing our country including, but not limited to, the deteriorating situation in North Korea. Almost lost in all the noise was the breaking news that President Trump had dictated his son's misleading statements regarding his June 2016 meeting with Russian representatives -- a meeting that we subsequently learned was about Russian interest in helping Trump in his presidential campaign.  This is the closest evidence of Presidential involvement in a Russia coverup that we have seen to date. At the same time, the President has repeatedly hinted that he might try to remove the person conducting the investigation into any collusion or coverup -- Special Prosecutor, Robert Mueller. We need to build a firewall between this White House and Special Prosecutor Mueller's investigation and prevent more Trump firings.   Join me in demanding that Republicans help us block any Presidential appointments while the Senate is in recess in August.Trump and his surrogates have been openly attacking special prosecutor Robert Mueller -- a lifelong Republican and former Director of the FBI -- painting him as tainted by partisanship despite all evidence to the contrary. When it became clear that these smear tactics were gaining no traction, Trump began to go after his own Attorney General for recusing himself from the investigation and eliminating any possibility of using his position to interfere on behalf of the President.Time and time again, President Trump has made it perfectly clear that he has no qualms about firing people to thwart investigations into his misdeeds. We cannot afford to underestimate the actions he is prepared to take to stop this inquiry.Join me in calling on my colleagues in the House and Senate to protect Robert Mueller from White House intervention and allow the investigation to continue >>Chris Van HollenU.S. SenatorPaid for by Van Hollen for US SenateYou're receiving this email at: If you'd like to unsubscribe visit:

subject: 750,000 reasons to act
email_content: Friend,President Barack Obama implemented the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals DACA program to protect law-abiding members of our communities who sought a better life. These individuals were brought to our country as minors and know America as the country they love. They live here, work here, contribute to our communities, and many have started families here. They fulfill jobs that are crucial to our communities in fields like health care, computer science, and emergency services. Before DACA, millions were living in the shadows, afraid of being deported to a country that they've never known.  DACA brought them into the light and America has benefitted as a result. Our country is stronger and our economy is growing thanks to their efforts. All of that might end this September. Republican Attorneys General have given President Trump until September 5th to overturn DACA or else they will sue his administration.  If that happens, more than 750,000 hardworking, law-abiding Americans will face deportation to a country they don't know.  Families will be ripped apart. Our country will lose some of our most brilliant minds. Local communities will go without doctors, nurses, engineers, and so much more. We can't allow that to happen. Please, sign your name and demand President Trump protect DACA.  can and must do better for our DREAMers. Take action before it's too late. Thank you, Debbie----***Paid for and authorized by Debbie Wasserman Schultz for Congress***This email was sent to .To unsubscribe, go to:

subject: Your opinion on Betsy DeVos (survey)
email_content: Peter,Back in February, Joe voted against confirming Betsy DeVos as Secretary of Education because he knew she'd be a disaster for our schools and our kids.But thanks to Senate Republicans, she was confirmed anyway -- and she's been as bad as we expected. She's proposed devastating cuts to our education system, tried to hand money meant for public schools over to private corporations, and worked to end programs set up to provide student loan debt relief. Now, she's even announced plans to roll back critical Title IX protections for victims of sexual assault. That's why we want to know how you think she's doing, Peter. We need 157 more responses to meet our goal of 500.How would you rate Betsy DeVos' performance as Education Secretary?Good poor Donnelly for IndianaCONTRIBUTE for by Donnelly for Indiana-------This email was sent to DPWILLIS67@GMAIL.COM.To unsubscribe, go to:

subject: Will you join me?
email_content: Kaine for VirginiaWhen I was running for president, one of the things I said so often is that we need more love and kindness in this country. These are the values that have always motivated me -- and they're a big part of why I chose Tim Kaine as my running mate. If you mention Tim to anyone who knows him, whether it's a member of his church congregation who sang with him in the choir or a Republican senator who works with him across the aisle, you're likely to hear the same thing: Tim is a guy who believes in love and kindness. I'm proud to call Tim and Anne my friends, and I'm doing all I can to support Tim in his reelection campaign. Will you join me? Here's the thing: Losing the election was hard -- for all of us. It's also hard to keep mustering the energy to continue fighting, day after day, for the America we still believe in. But what would be hardest of all is giving up.Tim is someone who never gives up. When we lost in November, he didn't even take a vacation -- he went right back to work for Virginians in the Senate. For Tim, there was no rest for the weary. Guided by his love of this country and his care for the people he serves, he knew he had to continue to fight for what's right -- for Virginians and all Americans -- inch by inch, tooth and nail, no matter the obstacle. And now, more than ever, that's what we need in the Senate. So today, I'm asking you to help make sure we keep him there.Please join me in supporting Tim's campaign by pitching in $10 or whatever you can right now. Tim and I are both guided by faith, and during the campaign, we always reminded one another of this creed: Do all the good you can, for all the people you can, in all the ways you can, as long as ever you can.Let's make sure Tim can keep doing good for Virginia families in the Senate. Commit to supporting him before tomorrow night's midnight deadline: you.HillaryDONATE [  ] Paid for by Kaine for VirginiaThis email was sent to .If you no longer wish to receive updates from our campaign, please unsubscribe [  ].

subject: Do you live paycheck to paycheck?
email_content: Friend,Do you live paycheck to paycheck? It's a personal question, but an important one.If you said "yes," you're not alone. *More than 50% of Americans live paycheck to paycheck.*This means that most Americans live under constant stress, always wondering if they'll be able to make ends meet.In a country as great as ours, how did this happen? *It's because our current tax system decimates take-home pay. Effectively crippling American workers with unfair and unnecessary taxes.*As conservatives, we don't believe in high taxes. We believe in individual prosperity -- and that starts with letting you keep more of your paycheck. * If you're ready to lower your taxes and keep more of what you earn, let us know by signing on to support tax reform today >> < you,Team Ryan  Support tax reform >>  <  Paid for by Team Ryan, a joint fundraising committee authorized by and composed of Ryan for Congress, Inc., Prosperity Action, Inc., and the NRCC.Team Ryan320 First Street, SEWashington, D.C. 20003   This message reflects the opinions and representations of Team Ryan. subject: ④ new endorsements for an office with a big impact on elections
email_content: Peter,You probably know about our national secretary of state, but did you know many states elect their own secretaries of state? And that they have a HUGE impact on our elections?Secretaries of state are usually responsible for making sure elections are fair and transparent, coordinating the ballots for statewide elections, and processing your voter registration.It's a tall order, but all this and more are part of the job.Because secretaries of state have far-reaching effects on our democracy, we're endorsing four strong progressive champions running for this office: Kathleen Clyde OH, Nellie Gorbea RI, Jena Griswold CO, and Maggie Toulouse Oliver NM.Donate $3 to help elect these four women running for secretary of state and support pro-choice Democratic women running across the country: pro-choice Democratic women to state legislatures, governors' seats, Congress, and the White House are all essential -- but secretaries of state can affect your right to even vote in those elections in the first place.Republicans have used this powerful office to attack voting rights for years by making it harder for low-income Americans, the elderly, young people, and people of color to vote by purging voter rolls, closing voting locations, and other tricks.We need Kathleen, Nellie, Jena, and Maggie in office fighting to protect our voting rights from ruthless Republican attacks and making sure elections are free and fair. And you can count on us to endorse even more women running for this critical office in the months to come.Because these races don't get the most attention, a little money from us can go a LONG way to help them win.Donate $3 to help elect our four newly endorsed secretary of state candidates and women running for state and local office across the country: GuinnVice President of Campaigns, EMILY's List----This email was sent to .To unsubscribe, go to:    or gifts to EMILY's List or endorsed candidates are not tax deductible.Paid for by EMILY's List, www.emilyslist.org, and not authorized by any candidate or candidate's committee.

subject: Debbie's "toughest challenge yet"
email_content: Friends,One recent publication has called the 2018 election Debbie's "toughest challenge yet." I've been married to Debbie for 26 years. We've been through quite a few of these elections together. If you asked Debbie what her "toughest challenge" is, she'd probably say something like protecting health care for Florida families. Or stopping the Trump administration from destroying all the progress of the past eight years. Those are the things she focuses on -- the things that improve lives and bring stability to the people who elected her. But look, Debbie is up against four opponents. They're fundraising well and already coming after her. So our challenge is mustering the resources we need right now to be prepared for whatever comes our way. We can't skimp on that responsibility. The deadline to reach the $25,000 October goal is Tuesday. Please, if you can, chip in $ASK or more. I know Debbie will appreciate it.  always, always has our backs. That's true with her family and in her work. Let's make sure we don't let her down. Steve----***Paid for and authorized by Debbie Wasserman Schultz for Congress***This email was sent to .To unsubscribe, go to:

subject: Big News & Big Endorsements!
email_content: Dear Peter, Our election is just five days away and we have some big news to share. This week, I was honored to earn the endorsements of the Richmond Times-Dispatch, the Virginian-Pilot, and the Winchester Star. These endorsements come from a proven record of experience and ability to lead, as well as our campaign's positive policy vision for making Virginia the best state in the nation to live, work, and raise a family. This is big news because two of them endorsed a Democrat for LG in 2013. With five days left, we have to keep this momentum going and let voters know about these big endorsements before the polls open on Tuesday. We need to raise the money to get these big endorsements out to undecided voters. Will you help us with a donation of $500, $250, $100, or even $25 tonight? Only five days are left but we still have time. Our team is standing by to put every dollar raised tonight towards advertising these important endorsements to undecided voters. These endorsements are so important that a group of our supporters is offering to double-match donations which come in tonight towards our goal of $25,000. $25 Becomes $75 >>> $100 Becomes $300 >>> $250 Becomes $750 >>> $500 Becomes $1500 >>> Contribute Another Amount >>> plus match Our team is working overtime in the final week and your double-matched contribution will help share these critical endorsements with undecided voters. While we are very close to Election Day, our team still has time to get the ads up if we can raise the money tonight. Sincerely, Jill Vogel P. S. These endorsements will make a big difference in helping earn the support of undecided voters. Will you help us make a big difference by donating online to get this good news out to voters in the last five days? Even a $10 contribution will be double-matched and become $30. subject: Tax Reform Means a Better Tomorrow for All Americans
email_content: 1600 Daily   President Trump's goals have been the same since day one: bring tax cuts for hardworking, middle-income Americans; eliminate unfair loopholes and deductions; and slash business taxes so employers can create jobs, raise wages, and dominate their competition around the world.   ---------------- House Republicans Release Historic Tax Plan Yesterday, President Trump met with members of the House Committee on Ways and Means at the White House to discuss the newly unveiled Tax Cuts and Jobs Act. The plan lowers individual tax rates for low- and middle-income Americans, eliminates special-interest deductions, and repeals the death tax and Alternative Minimum Tax. “It’s tax cuts, it’s tax reform, and we added the word ‘jobs’ because it’s all about jobs,” said President Trump. “We’re going to have tremendous numbers of jobs pouring in.”   Read President Trump's statement  on the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act and  sign your name to support tax reform. Bringing Jobs Home to America In the Oval Office yesterday, President Trump announced that Fortune 100 tech company Broadcom Limited is moving its headquarters to the United States. The company is currently based in Singapore and employs over 7,500 American workers. Hock Tan, CEO of Broadcom Limited, said the decision to relocate Broadcam was driven by his “desire to give back to this country that has given me so much." The move will bring more than $20 billion in annual revenue back to the U.S."My administration is working every day to make the United States the most attractive place in the world to do business," said President Trump, “so that more and more companies like Broadcom come back to our shores, grow their businesses, and create more and more American jobs. And you see that happening on a daily basis.” See the full announcement  here . President Trump Announces Fed Chair Nominee  On Thursday afternoon in the Rose Garden, President Trump announced his nomination of Governor Jerome “Jay” H. Powell as Chairman of the Federal Reserve. Governor Powell was selected by the President because of his professional experience, commitment to sound monetary and financial policy, and strong record of independent judgement.  Governor Powell has been a Federal Reserve board member since 2012 and has built a reputation as an effective and well-respected policymaker who has the judgment and experience necessary to lead the Federal Reserve. He previously served as Undersecretary of the Treasury under President George H.W. Bush.    See more from the announcement  here.  Photo of the Day President Donald J. Trump announced the nomination of Jerome Powell to be Chairman of the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System | November 2, 2017 Official White House Photo by Andrea Hanks POTUS TODAY Today, President Trump departs for Hawaii, where he will participate in a United States Pacific Command briefing. Afterwards, President Trump and First Lady Melania Trump will participate in a tour of the USS Arizona Memorial. This is the President’s first stop before traveling to Asia for his longest foreign trip since taking office. During this trip, he will strengthen international resolve to de-nuclearize North Korea, promote a free and open Indo-Pacific, and advance American prosperity.  Vice President Mike Pence will travel to Maryland to visit the United States Secret Service Training Center.  COMING UP This weekend, President Trump will depart Hawaii en route to Japan where he will meet with Emperor Akihito and Empress Michiko and conduct working meetings with Prime Minister Shinzō Abe and other Japanese leaders to reaffirm that America stands with Japan against the North Korea nuclear threat. Next week, the President will be visiting South Korea, China, Vietnam, and the Philippines.  Tomorrow, Vice President Pence will travel to York, Pennsylvania, to speak with local families and businesses about the need for tax reform. subject: We can take what we did in VA nationwide >>
email_content: Derek, I want to take a moment to send you my personal gratitude for the hard work our grassroots supporters put in to helping Governor-elect Ralph Northam, Lt. Governor-elect Justin Fairfax, and Attorney General Mark Herring win Tuesday's elections here in Virginia. These victories, along with the 15 Virginia House of Delegates seats we flipped and major wins across the country, are the direct result of what happens when Democrats work together to win. I can't overstate how thrilled my wife, Dorothy, and I are knowing we get to pass the baton to a family that will fight to protect our progress and work tirelessly for even more. I know that Ralph and Justin will continue our hard work -- keeping our unemployment rate low while creating more jobs, further expanding access to affordable health care and the ballot box, and continuing to give our teachers everything they'll need to prepare our children for the future. That's what happens when more Democrats win. We can take what the Democratic National Committee did in Virginia nationwide in 2018, Derek. And we should. subject: my new tattoo
email_content: Dear team,When the DSCC asked me to help out with the Women's Senate Network, I told them I'd do anything.  Knock on doors.  Stuff envelopes.  Get a huge "Women's Senate Network" tattoo."Um, how about let's start with a fundraising email?" they suggested.  Good idea.Please click here to make a contribution to the Women's Senate Network to support the TEN Democratic women senators on the ballot in 2018! if you are a keen political observer, you will notice that I am not, myself, a woman.  So why is the Women's Senate Network so important to me?  Three reasons.1. The ten Democratic women up for re-election next year represent nearly half of all women in the Senate.  And the last thing we need around here is to have fewer women in positions of power.2. The Republican plan for growing their majority and ramming through more of President Trump's far-right agenda revolves around taking out as many of these women as they can -- in fact, several are already facing attack ads.3. These women aren't just Democratic votes -- they're Democratic leaders, including dynamic progressive champions like Elizabeth Warren and Tammy Baldwin, tough-as-nails fighters like Claire McCaskill and Mazie Hirono, and even Amy Klobuchar: my senior senator, my role model, and one of the smartest, hardest-working, and okay, I'll admit it funniest people in Washington.Imagine what the Senate would be like without these women, and you'll understand why we can't afford to lose any of these incredible leaders.Will you help me help them by making a contribution to support the Women's Senate Network today? I know all about tough races.  But there's no denying that the other side makes it even harder on women who dare to step up and run.  Those who do it anyway -- and win -- often wind up being some of our most indispensable leaders: tough, smart, courageous Democrats who never back down from a fight.It's also why it's so important that we stand with them right now.  We've never had an election where so many Democratic women are under attack -- and the truth is, 2018 is shaping up to be an even tougher-than-usual year to be on the ballot.So I hope you'll join me in support of the Women's Senate Network by clicking here and making a contribution right now.  Especially because Franni tells me the tattoo idea is a non-starter. I'm going to do everything I can to stand with these ten awesome women - and I hope you are, too.  A great way to start would be to click here and help support the Women's Senate Network today! No, I believe it’s because we have failed to utilize technology as well as they do.The Progressive Left is efficiently reaching millions online through advanced digital media and data technologies. Their partnerships with top high-tech companies – like Google, Facebook, Twitter – are enabling them to be louder and stronger!Yet, Christians could easily be the most potent voting block in America. We are 90 million strong… if we simply vote.Christian values in our society are in jeopardy, and we must use new tools to mobilize the Christian vote if we hope to see America stand strong for God.That’s why I’m so excited about My Faith Vote’s Personal Voting Assistant.  It’s technology that makes preparing to vote and then voting easy.  It is now more possible than ever to see 90 million Christians stand united at the ballot box!But we need your year-end support to cover our funding gap for this technology.Every gift you give in 2017 will be doubled by generous matching grants up to $50,000! < you give today, you empower more Christians to benefit from our state-of-the-art technology, helping them register to vote, request absentee ballots, find their polling locations, and receive reminders to get them to the polls!Nearly 90% of Christians who used our tools turned out to vote! email_content: Peter, The headlines about Joe's race are heating up, and the spotlight will only get brighter. Pundits and political forecasters are already predicting this race will cost upwards of $100 million. One even ranked it as "Leans Republican" -- they think Joe's the most vulnerable Democratic incumbent in the Senate. Extreme special interest groups have read those rankings, and they've already flooded the airwaves with millions of dollars worth of ads to try and smear Joe. Countering their attacks will require the most robust media plan in the country. That means if we're going to fight back against their dishonest spots on TV, radio and online, we need you. Will you help us make sure the other side's special interest assault doesn't go unanswered? subject: Don't Let GOP Stop Mueller's Investigation of Donald Trump
email_content: Republicans want to end the investigation into Trump’s Russia ties. We cannot let them.   The petition to congressional leadership reads:“The congressional investigation into Trump cannot conclude until Special Prosecutor Mueller has wrapped up his investigation.”  Add your name:      Dear Activist,   Republicans have sought every chance to delegitimize special counsel Robert Mueller. Now, they are ramping up their attempts to derail Mueller’s inquiry into Trump’s Russia ties with calls to shut down the parallel, ongoing congressional investigations, thus making it appear as if Mueller is on a wild goose chase.1Republicans have spent months stymying the investigation by refusing to schedule interviews with key witnesses and sitting on requests from Democrats to subpoena relevant documents. Now powerful House Republican leaders such as Rep. Trey Gowdy – an extreme right-wing Republican ideologue – are reportedly talking about shutting down the investigation.2 This is unacceptable.Trump’s lapdogs in Congress are making up excuses to conclude their investigation into Trump’s Russia ties to pressure Mueller to end his investigation – and shut down Democrats like Rep. Adam Schiff who have relentlessly pursued the truth. We need a large outcry right now to shame Republicans into continuing their investigation.Tell congressional leaders: Don’t bow to Trump by ending the Russia investigation. Click here to sign the petition.  There is no way congressional investigators have actually finished their work. No one yet knows the full extent of Trump’s ties to Russia, and special counsel Mueller keeps uncovering new information that warrants congressional investigation.Republicans are sabotaging an investigation with national security implications. House Intelligence Committee Chair Devin Nunes repeatedly refused requests from his Democratic colleagues for interviews with as many as 30 witnesses and blocked potential subpoenas of relevant documents.3 Financial crimes are notoriously difficult to uncover, and thorough investigations can take years.4It is evident the investigation to date has not been sufficiently thorough. Democratic Congressman Jim Himes says that there are so many unanswered questions that Democrats would have to list them in a minority report if Republicans get their way. 5Mueller and the congressional investigators have two different jobs. Mueller’s narrow focus is on whether anyone connected to the Trump organization – or Trump himself – committed specific crimes by coordinating with Russians. Congress is investigating Russia’s attempt to hijack our democracy and whether Trump or his campaign engaged in shameful and improper collusion with Russia even if it does not violate specific laws. Congress’ responsibility is to ensure thorough fact finding to uncover answers for the American public. Republicans are refusing to get the real facts in a bid to undermine Robert Mueller, and we cannot let that happen.Tell congressional leaders: Don’t bow to Trump by ending the Russia investigation. Click here to sign the petition.  The effort to derail Mueller began among fringe supporters and the alt-right fake news, but Trump Republicans are now blatantly launching a systematic and coordinated attack on his investigation. The current Republican attempts to end the ongoing congressional investigations are part of an alliance with the extreme right-wing and Trump sycophants in Congress to systematically undermine Mueller and his investigation.6 By insisting that there are no other questions to ask, or evidence to examine, Republicans hope to create a media firestorm from the extreme right wing that will either shut down or sabotage Mueller’s investigation.The public has a right to know the extent of the potential collusion between Trump and his associates and the Kremlin. As long as there are witnesses to interview, and questions remain, Congress must keep up this crucial work.Tell congressional leaders: Don’t bow to Trump by ending Russia investigation. Click the link below to sign the petition.    Thank you  for speaking out,  Kaili Lambe, Director of OrganizingCREDO Action from Working Assets    Add your name:         References: Nick Baumann and Ryan J. Reilly, “Republicans Have Dramatically Ramped Up Their Attacks On Russia Probes In 2018  ,” Huff Post, Jan. 11, 2018.Susan Hennessey and Benjamin Wittes, “Congressional Republicans have pulled a bait-and-switch in the Trump-Russia investigation  ," Chicago Tribune, Dec. 22, 2017.Olivia Beavers, “Intel Dem says minority may publish report detailing panel Republican attempts to hinder Russia probe  ,” The Hill, Jan. 2, 2018.Diana Pilipenko, “The only two reasons to rush the Russia investigation are ignorance or politics  ," NBC News, Dec. 21, 2017.Beavers, “Intel Dem says minority may publish report detailing panel Republican attempts to hinder Russia probe  .”Baumann and Reilly, “Republicans Have Dramatically Ramped Up Their Attacks On Russia Probes In 2018  .”      Share on FacebookPost to your wall    cannot end its investigation into Trump’s Russia ties until Mueller has completed his.  Don’t let %40DevinNunes hide the facts.  via %40CREDOmobile. subject: Thank you, Mr. Vice President
email_content: I had to make sure you saw this news, Friend. Joe Biden just endorsed our campaign. I’m honored and proud to have the support of our former Vice President. Joe Biden knows the hard-working men and women of our state -- it’s why he was known as Pennsylvania’s “third Senator.”He’s always fought for working families, and I’m humbled he has put his faith in me to carry on that fight in Congress.So please, take a few minutes to read his endorsement, then chip in to help send me to Congress so I can be a voice for PA-18’s working families. Thank you,Conor Forwarded message ----------From: Joe BidenDate: Thurs, Feb 8, 2018 at 2:29 PMSubject: Conor LambFolks –"Service is the rent we pay for living."It's a powerful notion. And one that Conor Lamb embodies.A Marine Corps officer. A federal prosecutor. Conor has committed himself to public service.Now Conor is running in Pennsylvania's 18th Congressional District and I'm hoping you'll join me in supporting him and making a donation here to his campaign for Congress. 18th is in western Pennsylvania. It's a place where, as Conor says, "People have always gone to work, often at an early age, and often with their hands. It's where our parents and grandparents built the bridges and roads that built this country. And then built the businesses that had trucks drive over them."Conor Lamb will be a strong voice for working people. He's not afraid to say the word "union" -- and more importantly, he's not afraid to stand up for organized labor.Conor knows that teachers and nurses and cops and construction workers deserve someone who will stand up for them in Congress. But that's not enough. They deserve someone who respects them, values what they do, and thanks them for the service they give every day to their community, their state, and this nation, too.I hope you'll join me in supporting Conor Lamb and making a donation here to his campaign for Congress. JoeDONATE for by Conor Lamb for CongressThis email was sent to .If you no longer wish to receive updates from our campaign, please  Lamb for CongressPO BOX 10381Pittsburgh, PA 15234

subject: They are our future
email_content: Hello,Tomorrow, students, teachers, parents, and millions of other Americans will march in the streets of Washington D.C. and cities all across the country to demand that our elected officials take action to end the epidemic of gun violence.Turning trauma and an unthinkable tragedy into positive action isn't easy, but the students and teachers of Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School have done exactly that. They have inspired millions of Americans to say #EnoughIsEnough. They've used their platforms to talk about the pervasive gun violence in communities of color, and they've pushed their legislators to change our laws.Whether you're taking part in a march in your community or standing in solidarity with marchers around the country, you're a part of this movement -- and together we can make sure it doesn't end tomorrow once the marches wrap up.Add your name now to stand in solidarity with everyone participating in the March for Our Lives tomorrow, and then share to spread the word and keep the pressure on.>>  don't want my children to grow up in a world where gun violence is the norm and where active shooter drills are taught alongside math. Our young people are asking us to do something to save their lives -- and it's about time our elected officials listened.Tomorrow, these young people will be making history and Andrew and I are proud to stand alongside them.Join us in standing in solidarity with the students and marchers tomorrow -- then share and ask your friends and family to do the same. Together, we can make #NeverAgain a reality.>>  you,R. Jai Gillum----Paid for by Andrew Gillum, Democrat, for Governor.1550 Melvin Street, Tallahassee, FL 32303 This email was sent to .To unsubscribe, go to:

subject: Don't let this be the end
email_content: Today is the actual anniversary of the Affordable Care Act. Eight years ago, we celebrated as President Obama signed the law that would stop people with pre-existing conditions be denied health care and help millions of Americans get insurance for the first time.But this anniversary is bittersweet. Ever since President Trump took office and Republicans took control of both houses of Congress -- they've done everything they could -- short repealing of it -- to sabotage the ACA.One year ago, Americans came together to convince enough Republicans not to repeal the ACA and leave millions uninsured.We need to keep protecting the ACA from repeal efforts. If the past has taught us anything, it's that the ACA will always be a political punching bag for Republicans. If they had their way, this would be the ACA's last anniversary.That's why I want you to pledge to speak out against any attempts to repeal the ACA. Show Republicans you're not backing down. Add your name now. you,Debbie----***Paid for and authorized by Debbie Wasserman Schultz for Congress***This email was sent to .To unsubscribe, go to:

subject: Mike Pompeo is the top diplomat America needs
email_content: 1600 Daily   The White House - April 13, 2018  Driving the Day  Vice President Mike Pence departed Washington, D.C., this morning to represent the United States at the Opening Ceremony of the eighth Summit of the Americas in Peru. Before the summit, the Vice President will meet with Venezuelan opposition leaders at the residence of the U.S. Ambassador in Peru.     Mike Pompeo is the top diplomat America needs  CIA Director Mike Pompeo believes that leadership is about results. And for the past 14 months, those results have been exemplary. From pressuring North Korea to dismantling ISIS, some of the Trump Administration’s biggest foreign policy accomplishments wouldn’t have been possible without CIA support under the watch of Director Pompeo. Pompeo’s successes come from proven experience. He has been privy to some of America’s toughest national security challenges since 2010, when he served on the House Intelligence Committee as a freshman member of Congress. He’s had stints as a U.S. Cavalry officer, an entrepreneur, an executive—even as Editor of Harvard Law Review. His storied career adds up to one certainty: Mike Pompeo will be ready to lead the State Department on day one. With the grave threats facing our country, America needs him as our next Secretary of State. More:  Why Mike Pompeo is the leader America needs as its top diplomat    Tax cuts are energizing employers of all sizes  President Trump shared big news from the Rose Garden yesterday. Optimism among American manufacturers has reached unprecedented levels, according to a new survey from a leading industry group. Manufacturer optimism stood at 93.5 percent, the second highest reading in the survey’s history. Even better news is what that means for workers. The same survey showed that manufacturers anticipate wages will grow at the fastest pace in 17 years. “All you used to hear is that we’re losing our manufacturing jobs; jobs are being taken out of the country,” President Trump said yesterday. “They’re coming back and they’re coming back fast.” Other major reports tell the same story. Small businesses across sectors are worrying less about taxes and are investing more in their workers, according to a National Federation of Independent Businesses survey last month. And Ernst & Young reports that 89 percent of executives say their companies plan to increase worker compensation as a result of tax cuts.  See how President Trump’s tax cuts are energizing American employers of all sizes.     Photo of the Day  Official White House Photo by Andrea Hanks  President Donald J. Trump delivers remarks on Tax Reform to American Workers    Privacy Policy  |   Contact the White House  |  Unsubscribe

subject: Tax Day
email_content: Friend,Back in December, Senate Republicans rammed a vote through on their alleged "tax bill," set to give massive windfalls to Wall Street, big corporations, and the wealthiest 1% at the expense of American families.And while Donald Trump tours the country peddling his GOP tax scam, this Tax Day, Americans are seeing the real effects of this bill.According to a CNBC poll, only 32 percent of the public reports having more take-home pay because of the tax cuts, and more than half say they see absolutely no change in their paycheck.1This disastrous legislation is another reminder that Maryland's working families are not a priority for Washington, which is why next year we must elect a progressive governor with the courage to ensure that our state moves forward no matter what happens in Congress.We can't let the GOP get away with stripping basic provisions from working-class Americans simply to give tax breaks to billionaires. If you believe in the power of progressives to fight for tax fairness, create good-paying jobs and grow Maryland's economy, can you chip in $5 to our campaign today? families are already struggling with wages that aren't rising fast enough while paying more and more for their healthcare and housing. The last thing they need is a tax increase.Republicans have decided to put permanent tax cuts for massive corporations ahead of protecting real American people, and this will not stand.We can and must do better. Marylanders have no time to waste -- chip in $5 today. IN  FOR BY FRIENDS OF BEN JEALOUS, JASON SMALL, TREASURERThis email was sent to . subject: nothing to stop McConnell
email_content: Hi Peter,Some of you may remember me from 2012, when I ran Joe's first campaign for the Senate. I'm very proud of the work we did on that campaign -- we were serious underdogs from the very beginning, and we worked our hearts out to pull ahead in the fall and come out on top. With the help of tens of thousands of folks just like you, we won -- and Hoosiers sent one of the hardest-working people I've ever met to represent them in the Senate.Now Joe needs your help again. Indiana's 2018 Senate contest will be one of the tightest races in the country, so it's critical that Joe knows you're on his side. Will you add your name to show him you support his re-election campaign? >> in 2012, I signed up to run Joe's campaign because it was clear to me that Indiana needed an independent voice in the Senate who would fight for working Hoosier families -- and that's exactly what we got in Joe. Just take a look at his record:He defended health care access for working families.He opposed Mitch McConnell's disastrous tax plan.He's protecting Social Security & Medicare for retirees.But Peter, it could all be for nothing if McConnell and the Koch brothers have their way. Joe is facing a flood of special interest money, and it's only going to get worse -- especially once Republicans choose their candidate in just three weeks.Just like in 2012, Joe isn't relying on special interest money for support -- he's relying on people like you, the hard-working folks he fights for in the Senate. Add your name -- Joe's in the fight of his political life and he needs to know you're with him. is going to be a tough campaign. subject: The Keep Families Together Act
email_content: Peter,Like many of you, I am extremely alarmed about the situation at our southern border. The Administration's new policy of separating migrant children from their families is wrong and inconsistent with our values as Americans.It's no secret that our country's immigration system has been broken for a long time. I have long supported a bipartisan approach to fixing it, and I'm still hopeful that we can work together to get it done.But the separation of young children from their parents at the border requires immediate action. That's why I cosponsored S. 3036, the Keep Families Together Act.I hope you will join me in continuing to voice your opposition to the cruel policy of family separation as we work toward a solution. This issue is too important to stay silent about.Thanks,JoePaid for by Donnelly for Indiana-------This email was sent to DPWILLIS67@GMAIL.COM.To unsubscribe, go to:

subject: ACT NOW: Gun violence is a public health crisis
email_content: DeVos embarks on European tour during school safety listening sessionSchool Safety panel will not look at guns, DeVos saysWe cannot take Betsy DeVos seriously if she does not take guns in our schools seriously. Not only did she blow off a listening session for the Federal Commission on School Safety, opting instead for a leisurely tour of Europe; she also refused to allow discussion on gun violence during the session. As a working mother, I have to know with certainty that schools are able to educate my children and keep them safe. We cannot do that without a comprehensive plan for common sense gun reform. I'm taking action. Add your name if you're with me. same prohibitions that bar an individual from buying a gun also prohibit ammunition purchases, but there is no verification. I have introduced legislation to require anyone buying ammunition to pass the same background check as anyone buying a gun, with no loopholes. This bill will help to keep bullets out of the hands of those who shouldn't have them. And while no single law will stop every tragedy, this is exactly the kind of common-sense idea that could make a big difference. We owe it to our children to give them a leader concerned with safety and education, not profits. Betsy DeVos is not the answer. If you can't bear to see another Parkland or another Santa Fe or another Newtown, then demand DeVos take gun safety in schools seriously.  you. Debbie----***Paid for and authorized by Debbie Wasserman Schultz for Congress***This email was sent to .To unsubscribe, go to:

subject: We cannot give up
email_content: As if the devastating images of crying children being separated from their mothers and fathers weren’t enough, it was revealed today that Miami-Dade County is home to a secret, jail-like facility that houses untold numbers of migrant children.It makes me sick to my stomach knowing that only a few miles down the road from where my family lives, scores of innocent children are being held like prisoners.The Trump administration policy of family separation is nothing short of immoral. The mass incarceration of children is immoral. This must end.And yet our current Congressman has done nothing to alleviate this gross injustice but offer hollow words of disappointment. Mario Díaz-Balart says what he believes we want to hear, and yet he does nothing while young, scared boys and girls sit desperate and terrified, in internment facilities managed by private prison operators like GEO Group - one of Mario’s major campaign contributors.Díaz-Balart’s inaction in the face of this sort of abject immorality is nothing short of cowardice. We can debate differences in public policy, or the role of government in our lives, but there is no room for debate when it comes to these children.We cannot give up on these kids. Lip service is not enough. But it’s all we are getting from Mario Díaz-Balart. And that - in and of itself - is as immoral as it is cowardly.- Mary Barzee Flores          -----------------------------------------------------|    Paid for by Mary Barzee Flores for Congress    |-----------------------------------------------------Mary Barzee Flores for Congress c/o – Gloria Maggiolo6619 S Dixie Hwy, #148Miami FL 33143 United StatesIf you believe you received this message in error or wish to no longer receive email from us, please

subject: re: the budget
email_content: Just last night, I signed our 2018 budget.Both Republicans and Democrats came together to make smart investments in education, combating the opioid crisis, protecting seniors, and expanding workforce training to help bring more good paying jobs to Pennsylvania. It's a responsible and bipartisan plan that I'm proud to support.After fully restoring the massive education cuts made in the previous administration, we're now investing an additional $190 million in public education so that we can make sure that our children are getting the best education possible to succeed. And businesses only want to invest in states that invest in their future.We have also dedicated additional $70 million to fund school safety programs that are critical to protecting our children.Our budget also includes a first-of-its-kind $30 million strategic investment in job training and workforce development so students and workers gain the 21st century skills to get good jobs that employers demand.But listen, let me remind you that our fight is far from over.Over the past three years, we've been able to accomplish so much together. Now that this year's budget is complete, it is imperative that we all continue to work together to focus on moving Pennsylvania in the right direction.Since day one, I've promised to change Harrisburg by prioritizing issues important to Pennsylvania families. That's what we've been able to do with this budget. And that's what I hope to as your Governor for another four years.I'm proud of the work we've done together, and hopeful for the work we'll continue to do together to change Harrisburg.Onward,Tom WolfPaid for by Tom Wolf for GovernorWe believe that emails are an important way for the campaign to stay in contact with supporters like you. This campaign appreciates any feedback you might have -- positive or negative. subject: Richard Painter Newsletter (Week of July 8)
email_content: Friend --Here’s what Richard has been up to the past week: Last week Richard traveled around Northeastern Minnesota, visiting Duluth, Grand Marais, Ely, and International Falls to meet with voters and discuss important issues.Duluth: On Monday, Richard spent time in Duluth meeting with people to discuss a variety of issues. He was interviewed by the Duluth News Tribune to speak about his campaign, and also met with Charlie, a prominent Native American leader, to discuss policies important to the Native American community.Grand Marais: Richard conducted a town hall meet-and-greet session at the Cook County Community Center where he spoke and answered questions from voters. This session was followed with a second meet-and-greet at the Wunderbar Eatery and Glamp Ground to hear from citizens and engage with voters. Ely: On Tuesday, Richard had an interview with WTIP Community Radio discussing his candidacy to Northern Minnesota voters. He then met with Tuesday Group, a progressive organization in Ely to discuss the PolyMet copper-nickel mine project and its ramifications on the the Boundary Waters and Lake Superior. The mine will gravely pollute these treasured waters and cause significant environmental damage. Richard continued discussing the disastrous copper-nickel mine with Sustainable Ely’s campaign to Save the Boundary Waters. He met with voters at the Ely Folk School to learn about the school’s crafts and skills business and discuss important issues to the community. Richard then met with local business people at the Piragis Northwoods Company, a rental company specializing in canoes and other outdoor equipment. The owner, Steve Piragis gave Richard and his team a tour of the company’s solar panels and discussed the importance of sustainable energy. International Falls: On Wednesday, Richard hosted a meet and greet at Coffee Landing followed by a tour of the surrounding area of International Falls. In addition, he met with park rangers and local environmental advocates of the Voyageurs National Park to discuss the importance of environmental preservation of the area. Following his tour of the National Park, Richard met with voters for a Pint with Painter at the Crescent Bar and Grille where he conducted a town hall meeting and answered a variety of questions. He held an additional Q&A segment with the Northern Progressives, a group that focuses on bringing constituents and candidates together to discuss issues and educate voters. We are marching towards Washington, and we are getting there one community at a time!  Can you help us out? < you,Painter For Minnesota Minnesota - PO Box 6780, Minneapolis, MN 55406, United States This email was sent to .  To stop receiving emails:  with NationBuilder -

subject: I am writing to ask if you can split a $3 donation between Andrew Gillum's, Ben Jealous' and Stacey Abrams’ campaigns for governor and my work traveling the country rallying and organizing progressive victories ahead of this November’s critical elections.
email_content: [1]Bernie Sanders   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌      Sisters and Brothers,   When I ran for president, I made it clear that our campaign was not just   about one person. It was about building a movement and creating a   political revolution. Here is the very good news. In the last two years,   we have made enormous progress in achieving that goal.   First, the progressive agenda that we have supported is now the agenda of   the American people. On issue after issue whether it is health care for   all, raising the minimum wage, pay equity for women, rebuilding our   crumbling infrastructure, making public colleges and universities   tuition-free, transforming our energy system, immigration reform, criminal   justice reform and many other issues, poll after poll shows the American   people are now solidly with us. They want, we want, public policies that   represent the needs of all the American people, not just the 1 percent.   Secondly, not only are we winning the ideological debate, we are also   making enormous progress in creating the political movement we need to   implement that agenda. All over this country working people and young   people are becoming engaged in the political process, are running for   office, and oftentimes they are winning. Just in the last couple of weeks   great candidates like Rashida Tlaib and Ilhan Omar pulled off major upsets   and will become some of the most progressive members of Congress. Wesley   Bell pulled off another great upset in Missouri and will become the   prosecutor in St. Louis County where Ferguson is located. James Thompson   won the Democratic nomination for Congress in Wichita, Kansas, and Randy   Bryce, a union ironworker, won his primary and now stands a good chance of   becoming the congressman from Paul Ryan’s very own district.   In other words, despite what you may read in the corporate media or hear   from the “punditry,” the political revolution is gaining momentum. But we   still have a long way to go. There are three great candidates running for   governor, all of whom are strong progressives and have a real shot at   winning if they have adequate resources.   That is why tomorrow I am heading to Florida to help Andrew Gillum win his   race for governor. Andrew is running his campaign on progressive ideas   like Medicare for all, repealing Stand Your Ground laws, banning assault   weapons, legalizing marijuana and a $15/hr minimum wage.   There are also two other candidates who need our help: Ben Jealous, who   with our support won his primary and now faces a tough fight to win the   governorship of Maryland. There are very few individuals I know running   for any office who have the lifetime record of progressivism that Ben   does.   And I am supporting Stacey Abrams who is running an extremely important   campaign in Georgia. If elected, she will defeat a right-wing extremist   and become the first African-American woman ever elected governor of any   state in the history of our country.   All three of these campaigns face unique challenges — all three are at a   financial disadvantage against their opponents. All three can use our help   to close that gap. So I am asking:   [  ]Can you split a   $3 donation   between Andrew Gillum's, Ben Jealous' and Stacey Abrams’ campaigns for   governor and my work traveling the country rallying and organizing   progressive victories ahead of this November’s critical elections?   Sisters and Brothers, we live in an unprecedented moment in American   history, and we need an unprecedented response. Together – black, white,   Latino, Native American, Asian American, women and men, gay and straight,   young and old – we must not allow Donald Trump and his supporters to   divide us up while they pass legislation to protect the 1 percent.   Because when we stand together as one people, united, fighting for a   progressive agenda, there is nothing, nothing, nothing that we cannot   accomplish.   Andrew Gillum, Ben Jealous and Stacey Abrams are fighting for that   progressive agenda, and I am proud to support their campaigns. I hope that   you will as well:   Make a $3   donation to Andrew Gillum's, Ben Jealous' and Stacey Abrams’ campaigns for   governor today:   [  ]   Victories for these three great candidates will change America in a very   significant way. Thank you for standing with them.   In solidarity,   Bernie Sanders                                   [  ]DONATE      You can unsubscribe from this mailing list at any time:

subject: A Major Victory on Trade
email_content: West Wing Reads Logo  "A Major Victory on Trade" President Trump won a major victory on trade on Monday, supplanting the North American Free Trade Agreement NAFTA and replacing it with something far more beneficial. The new deal will help American workers and manufacturers. Its also a win for Mexico, Christian Whiton writes in Fox News. Whiton notes that the Presidents trade critics have been proved wrong by an unmitigated victory for the USA. Trump understood the simple math that countries with which we have trade deficits would have to come to the negotiating table.*Click here to read more. [  ] *In *"The Washington Times"* [  ], Gabriella Muoz reports that most Americans dont want to see the U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement agency abolished, according to a new survey. Only 24 percent of voters advocated for terminating ICE while a 40 percent plurality disagreed with the proposal. The trend continued across all political parties, she notes. The Trump Administrations Affordable Clean Energy Rule respects how Americas founders limited authority of the federal government for good reason, the *"Colorado Springs Gazette"* [  ] Editorial Board writes. This plan assists states, consumers, and the market in achieving cleaner air with guidelines, proposed technologies, and incentives that work for diverse regions of the country.First Lady Melania Trump planted an Eisenhower oak sapling Monday afternoon on the White Houses South Lawn. . . Mary Jean Eisenhower, the granddaughter of former President Dwight Eisenhower, and Richard Emory Gatchell, Jr., a fifth generation grandson of former President James Monroe, joined the First Lady, Diana Stancy Correll reports in the *"Washington Examiner [  ]."* Supreme Court nominee Brett Kavanaugh's former colleagues at the Kirkland & Ellis law firm sent a letter Monday to the chairman and ranking member of the Senate Judiciary Committee urging his confirmation by the senate, Cameron Cawthorne reports in *"The Washington Free Beacon [  ]."* We saw first hand that he consistently displayed a keen intellect, sound judgment, exceptional analytical ability, and the highest level of integrity in representing our clients, Judge Kavanaughs former colleagues write.
