subject: How I'm working to earn your support
email_content: This email has a lot of information about what I've been working on, and I hope you will take a moment to read it.I need your support for my re-election campaign, and I want to make sure you understand why and how I'm working to earn it.  every day, we face news about President Trump's scandals, his lies, and the political catastrophes created by his administration. But that shouldn't detract from the progress that is being made despite his chaos.I have been leading the conversation on cybersecurity and the threats we face from foreign hackers. Beyond our election infrastructure, our energy grids and transportation systems are also susceptible to hacking attacks, with potentially disastrous consequences. We secured $380 million for election security earlier this year, and my amendment to establish a national cyber warfare doctrine passed the Senate earlier this month.I've also been fighting to protect investments in our rural transportation infrastructure in New Mexico. The Senate recently passed my bipartisan amendment for an additional $50 million to help maintain the Southwest Chief Amtrak route. Trains help connect New Mexico to the rest of the country, and keeping this route is critical to the local economy and the rural communities that rely on this line.And I'm standing up to President Trump's cynical attempt to force consumers to bailout uncompetitive coal and nuclear power plants. In a blatant effort to keep his campaign promises, the president is claiming a national security emergency to keep coal-fired plants open. But the truth is there is no national security emergency, and this artificial bailout will increase energy costs and leave businesses and households paying higher electric bills. I am going to keep fighting against this bailout and any attempt to drag us back on energy, and I will continue to push for modernizing and diversifying our energy grid.Some of these updates don't warrant a breaking news alert on your phone, but they are making a difference in people's lives. I came to the Senate to represent New Mexicans and our values, and we are making progress that will help people across our state and country.That is why I am asking for your support today. I am in my first Senate re-election race, and all this hard work and more will be undone if one of my extreme right-wing opponents defeats me this November. To make sure that doesn't happen, we need to reach our weekend fundraising goal by bringing in $5,000 in grassroots donations. Will you pitch in and help me reach this goal before the midnight deadline?  for all you do,MartinPAID FOR BY MARTIN HEINRICH FOR SENATEIf you would like to unsubscribe from these emails click

That'swhy my team and I are focusing on more grassroots organizing andexpanding our ad spending to reach as many voters as possible.That is why I am asking for your support today. subject: Grassroots donations...and ice cream
email_content: Friend --I'm from Vermont -- where the winters are brutal. You live through January year after year where the average temperature is just 9°. Nine. And when you work in freezers making ice cream for a living, it feels just a little bit colder. So it takes a lot to get me out of Vermont in the summer and fall -- but for Ben Jealous, it's worth it. That's why I was back in Maryland to talk to voters about why this election matters so much, and why I think my friend Ben is the best candidate for governor. His campaign is run on small donations and ice cream, of course, so he depends on the support of folks like you. I've donated up to the legal limit for Ben, will you join me in making a grassroots donation of $5 or more today?  Ben is fighting a system that has been rigged to benefit the wealthy and the powerful. And it's about time we get a democracy that works for the many. Not just the few. In this time of Trumpian destruction of everything we believe in -- in this time of "me first, screw you" -- people of conscience who understand the rhetoric he puts out have got to stand up and resist. Ben's opponent may be resisting a little, but he's not doing it with his heart and soul. I met Ben when I was arrested with him resisting big money in politics. That's how I know he's the right person to lead Maryland forward -- because he risks everything to resist tyranny. Unlike Larry Hogan, Ben doesn't have the windfall of big corporate money -- it's donations from real people that are going to put him over the finish line. Trust me, he's depending on you now: Donate $5 or more to show your support today.Thanks,Ben Cohen FOR BY FRIENDS OF BEN JEALOUS, JASON SMALL, TREASURERThis email was sent to . subject: Growing the Economy
email_content: Share   Tweet   Forward to a Friend  Election Day just one week away, I wanted to reach out to fill you in on some of the efforts we’ve made to grow the economy over the past two years.Our economic growth initiatives have been driven by a focus on growing the workforce, supporting our rural and farm economies, expanding economic incentives, fostering a cradle-to-career education system, and supporting our small businesses.In my first term, we’ve accomplished a great deal to grow the economy, but here are just a few highlights:* Passed the ThinkVT/Innovation Program to invest in small business accelerators, broadband expansion, and co-working spaces;* Made growing the workforce a top priority--and added 4,000 new workers this year alone;* Increased Downtown and Village Center Tax Credits, which, along with new TIF districts, will boost economic development in targeted areas around our state;* Invested $5 million in the Child Care Financial Assistance Program to make child care more affordable and accessible;* Boosted our investment into higher education by $7.1 million, with the additional dollars tied directly to tuition affordability;* Eliminated tuition for members of the Vermont National Guard attending state colleges;* Invested in Career and Technical Education CTE centers across our state, with new training equipment, new spaces, and expanded opportunities;* Added new small business advisors in underserved areas of Vermont;* Passed a sales tax exemption for equipment in our logging and processing sector;* Re-convened the Vermont Milk Commission to make recommendations on how to stabilize the dairy industry;* Launched the Vermont Outdoor Recreation Economic Collaborative VOREC program to grow our outdoor economy;* Increased our investment in marketing Vermont as a place to live, work, and raise a family; and* Modernized licensing requirements so servicemen and women could more easily transition into the workforce.In conjunction with our efforts to make Vermont more affordable--including two General Fund budgets with no new taxes or fees, $30 million in income tax relief, $71 million in avoided property tax rate hikes, and the largest investment in affordable housing in state history--these important initiatives will help expand economic prosperity to all four corners of Vermont.But we have much more work to do. With your support, I’m confident we can continue to build on this strong foundation for a prosperous economy.Sincerely,Governor Phil Scott Scott for Vermont, Glen Wright, Treasurer,P.O. Box 988, Montpelier, VT, 05602Want to change how you receive these emails?You can ** update your preferences  ** unsubscribe from this list

subject: Remembering George H. W. Bush
email_content: "On the day he turned 18, just 6 months after the attack on Pearl Harbor, George H. W. Bush volunteered for combat duty in World War II." White House • December 3, 2018** Remembering George H. W. Bush, ‘one of America’s greatest points of light’------------------------------------------------------------On the day he turned 18, just 6 months after the attack on Pearl Harbor, George H. W. Bush volunteered for combat duty in World War II. He would become the youngest aviator in U.S. naval history at the time, flying 58 combat missions—including one that saw his plane take enemy fire and require that he parachute into the Pacific Ocean to survive.That legacy alone would be enough to earn our Nation’s eternal debt and gratitude. For George H. W. Bush, it was only the beginning of a lifetime of public service. He would go on to become a member of Congress, Ambassador to the United Nations, Director of Central Intelligence, Vice President, and, finally, President of the United States.“President Bush always found a way to set the bar higher,” President Donald J. Trump and First Lady Melania Trump said in a statement over the weekend. “It is with great sadness that we mark the passing of one of America’s greatest points of light.”President Trump has proclaimed this Wednesday, December 5, as a National Day of Mourning as President Bush’s State Funeral is held in Washington.The President and First Lady’s statement on the death of George H. W. Bush  .‘A great American life’: President Trump’s official Proclamation  President Trump returns from the G20 Summit------------------------------------------------------------Yesterday, President Trump and the First Lady returned from Buenos Aires, Argentina, host of the 2018 G20 Summit. As world leaders gathered, President Trump kept his promise to put Americans first every step of the way.The summit kicked off with a historic moment: the signing of the United States–Mexico–Canada Agreement USMCA, which replaces the outdated NAFTA. For years, NAFTA helped incentivize offshoring, leading far too many manufacturing jobs to leave the United States. USMCA will rebalance American trade for the 21st century  .Another crucial meeting took place between President Trump and President Xi Jinping of China. Incredible progress was made on two fronts in particular. “President Xi, in a wonderful humanitarian gesture, has agreed to designate Fentanyl as a Controlled Substance, meaning that people selling Fentanyl to the United States will be subject to China’s maximum penalty under the law,” Press Secretary Sarah Sanders said in a statement.And on trade, the two leaders struck an understanding that leaves “unlimited possibilities for both the United States and China,” President Trump said. In exchange for the Trump Administration agreeing not to raise tariffs on $200 billion worth of product to 25 percent at this time, China will agree to purchase a substantial amount of agricultural, energy, industrial, and other product from the United States to reduce the trade imbalance between America and China.Out of respect for the Bush family, President Trump has postponed a full press conference on these historic actions until after President Bush’s State Funeral.Watch: Highlights of President Trump at the G20 Summit in Argentina  Photo of the Day------------------------------------------------------------Official White House Photo by Keegan BarberA portrait of 41^st President George H. W. Bush is draped with black cloth in the Cross Hall of the White House | December 1, 2018Privacy Policy  | Contact the White House  | Unsubscribe  White House . 1600 Pennsylvania Ave NW . Washington, DC 20500 . USA · 202-456-1111

subject: First Lady Makes Annual Christmas Visit to Children’s National Hospital
email_content: "Melania Trump spread her anti-bullying message on an annual Christmas season visit to a Washington children’s hospital..." First Lady Spreads Anti-Bullying Message at Kids’ Hospital------------------------------------------------------------“Melania Trump spread her anti-bullying message on an annual Christmas season visit to a Washington children’s hospital on Thursday, reading a story about a Christmas ornament named Oliver who is bullied by other ornaments in a family’s collection,” Darlene Superville writes for The Associated Press.The author of the children’s book sat a few feet away, thanking the First Lady “from the bottom of my heart” for inviting him to join her. “Mrs. Trump launched an initiative earlier this year to teach kindness to children, naming it Be Best,” Superville adds.Click here to continue reading.  number of Americans applying for unemployment benefits plunged by 27,000 in early December to 206,000, erasing a surge around Thanksgiving that now appears to have been a temporary blip triggered by an earlier-than-usual holiday,” Jeffry Bartash reports for MarketWatch  . “The decline in applications for benefits puts claims, a rough way to measure layoffs, back near a half-century low.”“Top Trump adviser Jared Kushner is winning bipartisan praise for driving a 20-year effort to reform prison sentencing and criminal justice to the finish line and ignoring repeated declarations that it was dead right up to last week,” Paul Bedard writes in the Washington Examiner  . Both liberal and conservative prison reform advocates are giving Kushner credit for uniting “an unlikely coalition that has the package on the verge of Senate passage.”“Congress must fund President Donald Trump’s border wall and close the ‘catch and release’ loopholes in the upcoming must-pass spending bill. We must do it now.” Rep. Ted Budd R-NC writes in The Daily Signal  . “The problem of illegal immigration is solvable, but will require compromise. A good place to start will be with border security measures that Democrats have historically agreed to.”“National security adviser John Bolton unveiled the Trump administration's new strategy for Africa as it works to counter Russia and China, as they expand their financial, political and military investments across the continent,” Elizabeth McLaughlin reports for ABC News  .Privacy Policy  | Contact the White House  | Unsubscribe  White House . 1600 Pennsylvania Ave NW . Washington, DC 20500 . USA · 202-456-1111

subject: The lie Christians MUST reject!
email_content: Peter,We live in a fast-pace, instant gratification culture. So, when it comes to politics and fighting for biblical principles, we can easily become frustrated when we don’t see instantaneous results.This is one of the reasons millions of people – more specifically millions of Christians – opt out of the political process, despite the desperate need for biblical truth in our culture and in the government.I believe our instant gratification culture has many Christians believing if we don’t see immediate results in the battle for religious liberty, sanctity of life, marriage, and family, then there is no hope and our involvement doesn’t matter. That is a LIE. There are lots of other lies stealing America’s soul.  The lie that God is dead. The lie that truth is relative. And the lie that Christians should surrender their values and their voices.But the truth is, our faith has something essential to offer our world. It’s actually what our world needs – they just don’t know it. And it’s why we must stand in unity and for truth.That is why My Faith Votes exists. To equip and mobilize Christians to stand for truth in our communities and in our nation, bringing the influence of our faith into the public square.It’s a long-term strategy, butlook at what people like you made possible this year!  - Launched a nationwide TV and radio campaign on TBN, Daystar, Fox News, Salem, K-LOVE, the Bott Radio Network, American Family Radio, and the Christian Satellite Network—reaching more than 150 million households with Biblical worldview and voting resources  - Introduced the Voting Assistance Center, the most comprehensive voting toolkit available to churches and Christian voters, along with My Voter Guide, the only ballot guide for Christians covering 100% of the 70,000 elections that occurred across the nation.  - Reached 325,000 students on 115 Christian College and University campuses equipping them to vote and vote from a biblical worldview  - Sent 4.9 million emails with faith-based news updates and 36 million Get-Out-the-Vote reminders to Christians across the nation  - Enabled concerned Christians to send 171,000 messages to elected officials expressing views on critical issues such as the Kavanaugh confirmation and immigration reform.Because of people like you, many more Christians are involved, informed, and voting in elections and transforming our communities.The truth is, our work doesn’t stop or slow down just because the midterm elections are over…it is not time to rest and disengage for the next two years. The work we do in 2019 will drive the outcomes in 2020.There is much to do in 2019 to mobilize millions of Christians in 2020, but we must end 2018 strong. We need your help. Our goal is to raise $380,000 before January 1st.Can we count on you to stand with us and make a year-end contribution to My Faith Votes < gift will be MATCHED dollar for dollar, thanks to a generous matching grant, but it must be in before the end of the year!If we want to see Christians reject the lies that are destroying our country, then we need your help TODAY. Christians can speak truth to the lies in our culture IF we reach, equip and mobilize them. A donation of any amount will make a difference.Thank you for giving of your resources now so that future generations can live in a nation that honors God! < We Stand.Megan WestHost of My Faith Votes LIVE-=-=-This email was sent to . subject: Sign my petition demanding action on gun violence
email_content: I have really big news. Last week, the House of Representatives passed the   first major piece of legislation on gun violence in a generation. It’s   called HR 8. Now, it heads to the Senate.   This bill would mandate background checks for every gun purchase in this   country. It goes a long way toward making sure people with criminal   records or a history of mental illness can’t get their hands on a gun.   Right now, I need your help in making sure this bill gets a vote on the   Senate floor. We know the NRA and the gun lobby will do everything in   their power to stop it. That’s why we need to come together to show the   strength of our movement.   [  ]Add your name next to mine to demand a vote this week in the Senate on   legislation to require background checks on all firearm sales in the   country.                              [  ]Sign the petition   We can’t lose sight of how important this moment is in our history, and   how hard we have worked to get here.   A little more than one year ago, the students from Marjory Stoneman   Douglas High School led millions of people in marches across the country   to demand action on gun violence.   And throughout 2018, people in communities across our nation registered   voters, knocked on doors, and organized to elect leaders who are willing   to stand up to the gun lobby and do what’s right.   Last week, new members of Congress like Rep. Lucy McBath -- who became an   activist for social justice after her son was shot and killed -- voted to   pass the first significant legislation on gun violence in 20 years.   This is a great step forward. When we work together, arm in arm, to   organize and raise our voices to demand action, we can win. But our fight   is not yet done. I need you to add your voice right now:   [  ]Sign now if you agree: Congress should act swiftly to pass universal   background checks »                              [  ]Sign the petition   This is just the first of many fights to come in our work to end gun   violence. I know that by working together, organizing on every block in   every community of this country, we can take on the gun lobby and win.   Thanks for standing with me on this. I’ll see you out there.   For The People,   — Kamala Harris                              [  ]Sign the petition                            You can unsubscribe from this mailing list at any time:

subject: Democrats Should Forget Impeachment and Turn the Page
email_content: "It would be divisive for the nation and a boon to our global competitors if Democrats choose to hobble our national agenda with superfluous..." Democrats Should Forget Impeachment and Turn the Page------------------------------------------------------------“It would be divisive for the nation and a boon to our global competitors if Democrats choose to hobble our national agenda with superfluous, partisan impeachment,” Carrie Sheffield writes in CNN. “Clearly, Mueller is moving on and it's time for us to move on as a country, too.”Despite the spin from Congressional Democrats looking for cover to pursue more political, obstructionist investigations, “special counsel Robert Mueller was not secretly gunning for impeachment in his statement on Wednesday . . . By a nearly 20-point margin, the American people do not want impeachment, according to polling by the Washington Post and ABC News. Let's move on and focus on issues that actually help the country, like opioid crisis alleviation, national security, infrastructure and health care.”Click here to read more.  Mueller’s analysis of the obstruction evidence in his own report makes clear that no investigation was obstructed. Not the FBI’s counterintelligence probe, and not his own. No witnesses were interfered with, and Mr. Mueller was allowed over two years to issue nearly 500 search-and-seizure warrants and interview anyone he wanted, including anyone in the White House,” The Wall Street Journal  editorial board writes. The report also “shows beyond doubt, there is no evidence of a conspiracy, broad or narrow.”Robert Mueller’s “message was another disappointment for Democrats, since it boils down to: I’m not going to help you drag this out,” the New York Post  editorial board writes. “Nothing changed after Mueller’s press conference. Except this: Democrats can’t have it both ways — shying from impeachment but wallowing in endless investigations and testimony that create more noise without shedding any new light.”“Luckily for American agriculture, President Trump negotiated a new trade agreement with Canada and Mexico called the U.S.-Mexico-Canada Agreement, commonly referred to as the USMCA, which will help agriculture immensely,” state agriculture officials Chris Chinn, Steve Wellman, and Mike Naig write in The Missouri Times  . “Across the country and all industry sectors, the USMCA will create roughly 176,000 jobs and inject more than $68 billion into the economy by increasing exports to Canada and Mexico.”“Everyone is curious about how such false information could have been pushed up the Obama administration’s chain of command to start a secret examination of a rival political campaign. The Democrats seem curiously uncurious to get to the bottom of the mystery,” The Washington Times  editorial board writes.Privacy Policy  | Contact the White House  | Unsubscribe  White House . 1600 Pennsylvania Ave NW . Washington, DC 20500 . USA · 202-456-1111

subject: Get to the truth
email_content: ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌                                                       [1]Beto for America      More than a year ago, a conservative radio host in Lubbock, Texas asked me   if I would vote for impeachment. Knowing that it might not be the most   popular answer in my home state of Texas, I said yes. It was clear to me   then, as it is now, that the future of our democracy is at stake.   Robert Mueller just made it crystal clear. Of the hundreds of pages in his   special counsel report, he chose to highlight both the obstruction of   justice and calculated attacks on our democracy by Russia. He said   something important: when the subject of an investigation obstructs that   inquiry, or lies to investigators, it strikes at the very core of our   government's ability to get to the truth and hold people accountable.   His message was clear. If we want to prevent this from happening again, we   must hold those responsible to account. The only way we can do that is for   Congress to meet this moment and begin impeachment proceedings.   [  ]Add your name if you agree it’s time to begin impeachment proceedings   so we can get to the truth and hold perpetrators accountable.   This systematic attack by Russia on our democracy demands the attention of   every American, and the only way every American can be represented   properly is through the House of Representatives. If ever there were a   moment to act, it is now. If Congress fails to do that, we have set the   precedent that some people are above the law in this country.   I believe those members of Congress who listen to the courage of their   convictions at this moment of truth will be rewarded by the judgment of   history. While we still can, we must hold the president accountable for   his blatant obstruction of justice and lies to investigators.   This is not about me running for president. It’s not something I take   lightly. It’s more important than any one election or one presidency. The   sanctity of our democracy is at stake, and we don’t have much time.   [  ]I hope you’ll join me in adding your name today to call on Congress to   begin impeachment proceedings.   Sincerely,   Beto                                 [  ]Contribute                           Contribute to Beto's campaign:  email was sent to . Email is the most important way for us to reach you about opportunities to act. If you need to remove yourself from our email list, click here to unsubscribe:  FOR BY BETO FOR AMERICAP.O. Box 3628 El Paso, TX 79923

subject: The question of Impeachment Proceedings
email_content: On Wednesday morning, Special Counsel Robert Mueller made clear that the ball is in the court of the U.S. Congress:"If we had confidence that the president did not commit a crime, we would have said so."Here's what Dan said:"It is clear that there exist ample factual grounds to begin impeachment proceedings against the President of the United States.Mueller's statements, and his report, make clear that further investigation and any warranted prosecution of the President is the responsibility of Congress. Under Article I of the U.S. Constitution, Congress has the power and the responsibility to carry forward this work on behalf of the American people."It is imperative that we maintain a commitment to the rule of law. And when the facts are so plainly in front of us, to turn away from them is untenable.In his comments, Mueller also re-confirmed what we have long known to be true: Russia launched a concerted attack on our political system and interfered in our elections. It's urgent that we take steps to protect our democratic institutions.Dan went toe-to-toe with Vladimir Putin's Russia when he worked in President Obama's State Department. We need a Senator like him who understands what's at stake and how to hold dictators accountable and defend American values.The White House's recent failures to comply with Congressional investigations only further demonstrate why Congress should open impeachment proceedings against Donald Trump. We need to elect a Senator like Dan who will uphold our democratic institutions and the rule of law.To do this we'll need your help. Can you take a stand and pitch in $19 before his End of Month Deadline at midnight?>>secure.actblue.com/donate/baer-email?refcode=20190531_em_fr_b1_alert_all&amount=25&recurring=on&recur_weekly=onDan was just endorsed by the Foreign Policy For America Action Network -- a group that strives to elect champions of strong, principled American foreign policy.It's never been more important to have experienced public servants like Dan in office instead of career politicians. We need leaders who will protect us from foreign adversaries, not bow down to their commands.Thanks for your support,Team Baer -------This email was sent to .To unsubscribe, go to:

subject: Three big updates:
email_content: Friend, before I ask you for help meeting our May fundraising goal before midnight I want to talk to you about some game changers for our campaign this week:- NRA TV went on the attack, criticizing my calls for a national gun licensing standard. The NRA is lashing out because they know we can beat them, like we already have in Colorado--passing universal background checks and high-capacity magazine limits. My message for them: We're not going anywhere, and we won't stand down.- I released my plan to protect women's reproductive rights across our nation by making Colorado's successful long-acting reversible contraception LARC program national. This would protect the rights of all women to control their own healthcare and bodies by providing access to affordable contraceptive options such as IUDs. In Colorado, the results spoke for themselves: We saw a 64% drop in teenage abortion, a 54% drop in teen pregnancy, and the program saved taxpayers $70 million.- I went on the record calling for impeachment inquiry: Robert Mueller's press conference on Wednesday convinced me that it's time for Congress to fulfill its constitutional duty to further the investigation.Week by week, we're growing this campaign and getting our message out, everywhere from local meet and greets to national outlets like CNN and MSNBC. Our vision of an America united behind smart, humane, progressive policies is gaining traction.But one more game changer hit our campaign this week. The DNC doubled the number of individual grassroots donors it will take to qualify for the later debates: from 65,000 to 130,000.Hitting that goal and taking our message to the debate stage to speak up for gun safety, reproductive rights, and more will take everyone on this team stepping up. The finance team tells me we're still over $20,000 from the goal we needed to hit by tonight, so I'm here to personally ask you:Before tonight's deadline, will you consider making your first gift to our campaign? Just $1 is all it takes to help grow this team: so grateful you're on this team and going on this journey with me.Thank you,John  -------This email was sent to .To unsubscribe, go to:

subject: Anyone can talk. What matters is action.
email_content: Friend, I'm still brimming with energy from last night--from seeing the names of Debate Donors who helped supercharge our campaign this week, to the adrenaline of taking the stage and sharing my vision of an America where we get progressive things done, together.Look--we heard a lot of great ideas on stage last night.But the truth is, I was the only one on that debate stage who has actually done what everyone else is just talking about. If that track record inspires you, help us take this campaign to the next level: used the scrappy spirit I developed as a small business owner to actually make Colorado one of the most progressive states in America.We got real results. We actually passed universal background checks, got to near universal health care, and attacked climate change with the toughest methane regulations in the country.We worked together--Democrats and Republicans, businesses and non-profits alike--to make a real difference in people's lives. We dramatically expanded reproductive rights and reduced teenage abortions by two-thirds. We were the first to legalize marijuana, and in the process transformed our justice system. And we created the number one economy in America.And we did it without radically expanding our government or touting socialism as the solution.Anyone can talk. But what matters is action. What matters are results.Today, our team woke up to face our next big challenge: our end-of-quarter fundraising deadline.The amount we raise by Sunday night's FEC filing deadline will decide how quickly we can grow this campaign--and show how many people share our goal of getting real results that change lives, and can change the course of our nation.If you like what you saw on the debate stage last night, chip in now: you,John-------Paid for by Hickenlooper 2020PO Box 6377, Denver, CO 80206Contributions or gifts to Hickenlooper 2020 are not tax deductible.We love staying connected to you—but if at any point you’d like to opt out, you can do so right here:  we’re not reaching you at the correct email address, please update your information here:  email was sent to .

subject: I'm not just another politician who's bought and paid for by the rich and powerful.

I don't take any money from federal lobbyists, corporate PACs, or PACs of any kind.Our campaign belongs to you, and you're the reason why I'm in this fight.But first, we need to send the strongest possible message to the special interests, in the only language that they speak: Money. That means we need to put out the strongest possible fundraising report after tonight's midnight FEC deadline.My team has crunched the numbers, and we can hit our goal -- but only if 42 more people from your state chip in. Can you be one of the 42? Every single donation -- of $3 or whatever you can pitch in -- adds up and makes a difference. what your contribution will mean: We'll be able to run a truly grassroots campaign. And that's the only way we'll be ready to transform Washington.Right now, because of decisions made in Washington -- tilted and distorted by the influence of big money -- our economy is only working for a thinner and thinner slice at the top.And when you've got a government and an economy that work great for the rich and powerful and not for everyone else, that is corruption, pure and simple.We need to call it out, we need to attack it head on, and we need to make big, structural change to fix it.I've got a plan for that -- to end Washington corruption, rebuild the middle class, save our democracy, and level the playing field for working people.But first, we need real resources to grow our person-to-person movement across the country. And we need to hit our goal before tonight's midnight fundraising deadline. It'll only happen if we all pitch in.I'm not just another politician who's bought and paid for by the rich and powerful. subject: READ: Governor John Kasich's CNN Op-Ed
email_content: What the U.S. is Doing to Migrant Children is an Unspeakable Disgrace    <   Governor John Kasich's CNN Op-Ed: What the U.S. is Doing to Migrant Children is an Unspeakable Disgrace < America's war on children must stop. What's happening on our southern border -- migrant children in overcrowded, unsanitary and unsafe conditions, separated from their families -- is an unspeakable disgrace and a stain on this nation we may never wash away. Watching and reading reports about the gross neglect and mistreatment we're inflicting on kids is appalling. I ask myself, "Can this be America? Is this the way we in this country treat any human being, let alone the youngest, most fragile and most innocent among us?" But it's true. What we're seeing now is undeniably un-American, inhumane and shameful. For no offense of their own, sick and hungry children are left to sleep on concrete, in their own filth, without adequate nutrition and medical care. Infants and toddlers, separated from their families, are being cared for by other youngsters who may be only a few years older. Is this happening because of cruel intent, scandalous neglect or a lack of funding?Ultimately, I care less about the answer to those questions and whom we can blame, and more about how we can help these children. Blame and dissension will not bring us solutions. That will take leadership. Republicans and Democrats in Congress need to set aside their differences and drop the endless back-and-forth finger-pointing, as well as the fighting within their own camps. Most of all, the President of United States has to be the leader here. There is no more urgent moral issue before him, but he's been engaged in the partisan blame game. That's unacceptable. Ending this war on children has become an afterthought in Washington's endless struggle over immigration policy. But this crisis at our border is more urgent. These are children. This is America. And we have to put the children first! Without delay, marshal this nation's resources to provide safe, humane conditions for children being held, while moving just as quickly to get as many as possible out of detention and into the care of family members or other sponsors. This means pushing our current fixation on election debates, town halls and other political concerns to one side -- and doing it right now -- so we can take care of these children first. Immigration policies, long-term fixes and the inevitable politics can come later. Do we need secure borders? Of course. Do we need a total overhaul of our system of legal immigration? Absolutely. Republicans and Democrats should work together to pass immigration reform that meets our economic and security needs while also creating jobs for Americans. But put the needs of these children first. In recent days there have been hopeful signs. The House and Senate have moved forward quickly on supplemental funding to ease conditions at the border. But Congress and the President need to come to a compromise that ensures the safety and well-being of these children. They must also realize that funding alone is not enough. A real solution will require much greater accountability, a real plan for going forward and a bipartisan commitment to taking care of these kids. All of this will take time, but the needs of these children will not wait. Today -- here and now — this business of crowding children into jail-like detention centers, while denying them adequate nutrition, sanitation and medical care has to stop. No debate, no excuses, no finger-pointing. Just stop! This disgraceful disregard for our own values is not who we are as Americans. It's not who we have ever been. To ourselves, and to so many others throughout the world, our country has represented the promise of something better. At some point we must step back, come together and do what is right for these kids. Because, only then, will our actions be right for America.Ending this war on children has become an afterthought in Washington's endless struggle over immigration policy.Share This: <  < Paid for by Kasich for America, not authorized by anycandidate or candidate's committee.www.JohnKasich.com Unsubscribe <

subject: Tijuana Authorities Investigating Migrant Groups Trying to Buy Children to Cross into the United States
email_content: "Some migrants in Tijuana are trying to purchase children from vulnerable single mothers in local shelters so they can more easily..." Tijuana Authorities Investigating Migrant Groups Trying to Buy Children to Cross into the United States------------------------------------------------------------“Some migrants in Tijuana are trying to purchase children from vulnerable single mothers in local shelters so they can more easily cross into the United States, according to shelter directors, migrants and Tijuana law enforcement authorities,” Wendy Fry reports for The San Diego Union-Tribune.“U.S. border authorities have been warning since June 2018 about people fraudulently using children who aren’t theirs to pose as family units and gain entry into the United States a claim that critics said was overblown. But now, authorities in Tijuana are warning migrant mothers to keep their children close by and supervised, after reports of men offering to purchase migrant children in order to cross.”“I can’t go to work because I can’t take my eyes off my boys,” a migrant from Honduras says. “They want to rob our kids so they can cross into the United States.”Click here to read more.  look now, but quietly or at least in a way that hasn’t really been absorbed by much of America, there is positive movement on health care reform. Before anyone knows it, we might just find that the ground has been set for meaningful reform,” The Dallas Morning News  editorial board writes. Most recently, President Donald J. Trump signed an executive order last week that pushes for greater transparency in healthcare pricing. “The president is on the right track. We have a right to know what we’ll be charged and keeping it all a secret until we’re on the hook invites waste and inefficiency.”Former President Obama's Secretary of Homeland Security criticized Democrats who came out in support of decriminalizing illegal border crossings, Julio Rosas reports in the Washington Examiner  . “That is tantamount to declaring publicly that we have open borders,” Jeh Johnson told The Washington Post. “That is unworkable, unwise and does not have the support of a majority of American people or the Congress, and if we had such a policy, instead of 100,000 apprehensions a month, it will be multiples of that.”“For the first time in a U.S. trade agreement, the USMCA would include rules to address all biotechnologies, including new technologies such as gene-editing, to support 21st century innovations in agriculture,” Rep. Lloyd Smucker R-PA writes in Lancaster Online  . “These important and forward-thinking changes will prepare our farmers of today with the tools for tomorrow.”Privacy Policy  | Contact the White House  | Unsubscribe  White House . 1600 Pennsylvania Ave NW . subject: The next phase of our lawsuit begins today
email_content: Friend -Today, our federal lawsuit to overhaul the election system in Georgia takes a critical step forward. This morning marks the beginning of our four month discovery track, the legal procedure by which each side in this case can obtain important evidence. And for the first time, we have an anticipated trial date set for March 23, 2020, meaning that we'll be able to pursue justice for Georgia voters on the aggressive timeline we'd requested from the court. At its core, our lawsuit argues that voters deserve fair, secure elections. Because fair elections are the moral foundation of the compact between the government and its citizens. In 2018, Georgia's elections officials broke that compact by engaging in unconstitutional voter suppression and gross mismanagement. The result was an election that deprived Georgia citizens, and particularly citizens of color, of their fundamental right to vote. Our fight is about fulfilling the most fundamental promise of democracy: the right for voters to have their voices heard and their votes counted. But we need your help. Can you make a contribution right now to support our fight for free and fair elections? CONTRIBUTE »  work is critical here, friend. What happens in our case could set a national precedent for other states to follow. We know that we must leverage every resource before the 2020 elections to ensure that every eligible voter can access the ballot and to dismantle a system of suppression that violates the Constitution of the United States of America. Onward,Team Fair Fight---------This email was sent to .To unsubscribe, go to:  for by Fair Fight

subject: why it's crucial

That message resonated with voters across our district -- and the nation -- who were sick and tired of politicians who deepened partisan wounds by isolating themselves in the extreme corners of their parties.Their inaction hurt everyday Americans, and together, we said “no more.” Instead, our new generation of leaders is building bridges -- not burning them.I’m reaching across the aisle and finding allies who are eager to make progress on the challenges of day-to-day life. In fact, bipartisan legislation I authored to increase transparency in prescription drug pricing passed out of two committees and is working its way towards becoming law.There are countless other issues I’m confident we can find common ground on, but to do that, we need to keep this district in the hands of voters and out of the pockets of dark money donors funding extreme ideologues.Peter -- Your grassroots support today can help us make the most of these early fundraising deadlines and put us in a strong position to cross the finish line again with a victory in hand. Will you make a donation of any size so we can reach our goal? >>CONTRIBUTE »   you so much.Abigail    Abigail Spanberger is a proud Democrat, former CIA officer, and representative for Virginia's 7th Congressional District. She believes in leadership that flows from our shared American values of integrity, responsibility, and decency, and she wants to work to move this country forward together. subject: Justice for 241 Marines, Sailors, and Soldiers
email_content: On October 23, 1983, Hezbollah detonated a truck bomb outside of a Marine Corps barracks in Beirut, Lebanon. 241 Marines, Sailors, and Soldiers die  < Friend, On October 23, 1983, Hezbollah detonated a truck bomb outside of a Marine Corps barracks in Beirut, Lebanon. 241 Marines, Sailors, and Soldiers died.I was lucky to be alive — my battalion had shipped out just 10 days before the bombing occurred. I was able to come home and see my wife and family because of the Marines who replaced me in those barracks. I promised I would never forget the men that died that day. Last week, the House passed the Our Obligation to Recognize American Heroes OORAH Act, finally delivering some small semblance of justice for those who lost their lives that day. The OORAH Act makes $1.68 billion in Iranian government assets available for the families of the service-members who paid the ultimate price on October 23, 1983. Spread the word about the OORAH Act >> < never been more proud of a bill and it means everything to me to fulfill my promise to never forget the Marines who died that day. Please take a second and consider sharing the passage of the OORAH Act with your friends and family.  <  < Semper Fi,   Greg PencePaid for by Greg Pence for Congress  PO Box 275 Taylorsville, IN 47280  This email was sent to  Unsubscribe <

subject: INTERVIEW: Is there hope for the next generation? This Pastor explains
email_content: Peter,Do you ever find yourself worried about Millennials and Generation Z? Do you wonder if the next generation will be able to overcome apathy and entitlement?Or maybe you are part of the Millennial Generation or Generation Z, and you have experienced the disconnect between your generation and the ones above you.I sat down for a fascinating conversation < with Pastor Jonathan Pokluda from Harris Creek Church in Waco, Texas.Pastor Pokluda, the author of Welcome to Adulting, sheds light on the struggles the next generation is facing and explains how they can find life and find it abundantly. We’ve said it before, but it’s worth mentioning again; Millennials and Generation Z will be the largest voting bloc in 2020. This means, not only will they influence elections, they lead our culture.To advance a biblical worldview, we must first understand the next generation and then equip them with truth to make a difference. Pastor Pokluda helps explain how we can do just that.“Millennials underestimate what they can do with long obedience in the same direction. I think they overestimate what they can do in the short term. And so what they are not doing well is patience, but what they are doing well is belief — believing that they can change the world.And if they take that belief and place it in something bigger than themselves — they begin to understand the purpose of why they were created. Then I believe the Holy Spirit, God, partners with them and shows them how they actually can.”– Pastor Jonathan Pokluda < our interview < and be encouraged and challenged by what he has to say about the next generation, the church, and our culture today.Pray. Think. Vote.Megan WestMedia Director < email was sent to .  To stop receiving emails:

subject: Celebrating Labor Day
email_content: Today's a federal holiday because on the eve of the 20th century, workers from across the country fought side by side and made their government recognize the importance of labor. Machinists, carpenters, and people who worked in mills, mines, factories, and more joined together to fight for better wages, better conditions, and a day to honor the power of working people. The fight for labor continues today. Out on the trail, I've spoken with union members who are teachers, nurses, postal workers, home health aides, janitors, truck drivers, and more. Labor groups are still fighting for an America that works for everyone, not just the wealthy and well-connected. They were on the front lines then, and they are on the front lines now. This is a crucial moment in the fight for workers in our country. Right now, the rich and powerful are doing everything they can to break the backs of unions. But unions aren't going away -- not today, not tomorrow, not ever. Unions built America's middle class, and unions will rebuild America's middle class. And I've got plans to rewrite the rules of our economy to give workers more power. Together, let's make it easier to unionize. Let's give those unions more power, get the Department of Labor and National Labor Relations Board to actually look out for labor, pass a nationwide ban on so-called "right to work" laws, and more. This is a crucial moment in the fight for workers in this country. It's a time for us to show whose side we're on. I'm proud to say that my campaign is unionized. All Democrats need to stand up and say, without hedging, that we support unions and we support legislation that will protect workers. Throughout history, workers have gotten together and gotten organized. Kids went from working in factories to going to school. Americans went from working twelve hours a day, six days a week, to the 40-hour week we know now.We must remember that when working people fight, working people win. And today, fighting shoulder to shoulder for big, structural change is how we're going to create an economy that works for everyone.Thanks for being a part of this,ElizabethDONATE NOW:  for by Warren for President____________________________________________All content © 2019 Warren for President, All Rights ReservedPO Box 171375, Boston, MA 02116____________________________________________This email was sent to .Click here to donate by mail:  unsubscribe, go to:

subject: At the White House today, 28 people become Americans
email_content: On this day 232 years ago, the Framers met in Philadelphia to sign our Constitution, setting our nation on a bold course to becoming a more perfect... White House • September 17, 2019** At the White House today, 28 people become Americans------------------------------------------------------------On this day 232 years ago, the Framers met in Philadelphia to sign our Constitution, setting our nation on a bold course to becoming a more perfect Union.John Adams called the drafting of our Constitution “the greatest single effort of national deliberation that the world has ever seen.” During Constitution Week, we celebrate the American citizens who have devoted their lives to implementing the Framers’ vision of the world’s grandest, most successful experiment in self-government.In honor of that vision, Vice President Mike Pence led a White House naturalization ceremony today, where 28 new Americans officially became United States citizens.In photos: “Welcome to the American family,” Vice President Pence says.  is Constitution Day in America, but this is your day—your first day as American citizens—and you have our congratulations,” the Vice President said. “Welcome to the American family.”This moving ceremony represents everything that our great Constitution stands for. These 28 individuals all came from different walks of life, but each one hoped to be a part of the American Dream that’s seen as a symbol of hope throughout the world. This week, nearly 34,000 other individuals like these 28 will be welcomed with open arms as the newest citizens of the United States of America.“You all have one thing in common: You aspired to be Americans,” Vice President Pence said. “You stepped forward, you followed the law, you went through the process, and, today, you are American citizens. Well done.”See President Trump’s proclamation on Constitution Day and Citizenship Day.  This Constitution Week, America welcomes 34,000 new legal citizens  President Trump arrives in California!------------------------------------------------------------President Donald J. Trump continues his tour out West today, arriving in sunny California after spending last night in New Mexico.Despite liberal state leaders who often fail to address the state’s most pressing challenges, Californians have seen incredible results under President Trump’s economic program. Job creation has rebounded in a big way, with more than 870,000 jobs added since President Trump’s election. Perhaps even more impressive, in that same time period California’s unemployment rate fell from 5.4 percent to 4.1 percent—a record low.The difference-maker wasn’t more high-tax, big-government policies that the people of California have grown accustomed to seeing from their leaders. It was the pro-growth, workers-first agenda that President Trump began implementing on day one.But despite these gains, California cities continue to be hampered by a severe homelessness problem that the state’s left-wing leaders consistently fail to address.Nearly a quarter of the entire U.S. homeless population resides in California—about 130,000 people. Today, four of the five major American cities with the highest rates of unsheltered homelessness are in the state. To illustrate how dire the problem is, San Francisco has a rate of unsheltered homelessness of 60 per 10,000—10 times greater than the national average.How did this happen? There is plenty of blame to go around in the state’s leadership, but in general, left-wing policies such as overregulation have deepened the crisis, driving up the prices of homes and leaving more people unable to afford a roof over their heads.Making matters worse, many liberal leaders continue to ignore the rule of law—and the will of the people—by enabling massive illegal immigration. In the end, it’s their own constituents who pay the price. San Francisco’s leaders have loudly pushed for open-border policies even while their communities face a worsening homelessness crisis.President Trump is calling them out. His Administration is paving the way for more affordable housing development and bringing needed reforms to America’s housing finance system. Real work is already being done to reduce the risk factors for homelessness, such as improving addiction treatment and mental healthcare, as well as promoting career opportunities for former prisoners. Hopefully California leaders take note.Something to share: President Trump has delivered big results for California!  New York Times: “America’s Cities Are Unlivable. Blame Wealthy Liberals.”  Photo of the Day------------------------------------------------------------Official White House Photo by Shealah CraigheadPresident Donald J. Trump disembarks Air Force One at Moffett Federal Airfield in Mountain View, California | September 17, 2019Privacy Policy  | Contact the White House  | Unsubscribe  White House . 1600 Pennsylvania Ave NW . Washington, DC 20500 . USA · 202-456-1111

subject: Joe Sestak statement on autism
email_content: [ BY ADMIRAL JOE SESTAKAutism, or Autism Spectrum Disorder ASD, affects millions of families across the United States. As a member of Congress, I fought hard to secure the first new federal funding for autism treatment and services in over twelve years. The vehicle was the annual defense appropriations bill for fiscal year 2009 and the focus was increasing funds for families who have a loved one with ASD. At the time, I said this: “A new case of an autism disorder is diagnosed every 20 minutes, affecting one in every 150 American children as the fastest-growing serious developmental disease in the United States.” Sadly, in the decade since then the autism rate has risen to one in every 59 American children. Of course, it’s still quite unclear whether these numbers point to a steep increase in cases of ASD or merely in better public education about the condition and increased diagnoses, but in either case it is a serious concern demanding far more attention from policymakers.Some doctors and researchers are concerned that because of the complex nature of Autism Spectrum Disorders — and the wide range of treatments that have been tested — there may never be a complete “cure.” But there have been many advancements, and research is still revealing new information about autism every day. Some believe that gene therapy may yet provide a cure. But most everyone believes that early diagnosis and intervention can improve quality of life for people with autism and their families. Due to the brain’s plasticity, especially when children are very young, early intervention with the latest behavioral therapy techniques is showing great promise. We must increase funding, as part of the transition to a universal healthcare system, for evidence-based, medically necessary therapies and services for people with autism. And we must also increase funding for expanded research into the efficacy of various therapies, because there still has not been nearly enough such research thus far.Critically, we must also devote more resources to discovering the cause or causes of autism. While a “cure” still proves evasive, we must do everything we can to reduce the number of cases of ASD. We need to find out why the rate of autism is increasing faster among African American and Hispanic people, after having long been more prevalent among the white population, and how environmental factors and genetic factors come into play. Scientists are exploring many theories — from prenatal infection to hereditary genetics, chemical exposure to gastro-intestinal microbes, and combinations of multiple factors — but they lack the necessary resources to swiftly come to any conclusions. The federal government must step up and find the funding required to get the job done. We have no way of knowing how such research may improve the lives of people living with autism already, but we know it is our best chance at reducing the number of cases in the future.I fought throughout my time in Congress to increase support for individuals and families living with autism, beginning with military families. As President, I will continue to do everything in my power to support all Americans with autism and their families.If you'd like to know more about my positions on autism, on healthcare more generally, or on other issues, please visit my website at www.joesestak.com [ . You can also contact my press team for more information at press@joesestak.com [ or 914 272-5803.Respectfully,Joe SestakPaid for by Joe Sestak for President.Joe SestakP.O Box 17246Alexandria, VA 22302United StatesIf you believe you received this message in error or wish to no longer receive email from us, please unsubscribe:

subject: Nothing about committing crimes in public makes them any less criminal
email_content: [1]Beto for America      I started talking about how we need to impeach Donald Trump in 2017. Back   then, not a lot of folks knew where to stand on the issue and weren’t sure   if it was the best path to go down if we want to unite our country.   But everything we’ve learned these past weeks since we found out about   Trump’s phone call with Ukraine has confirmed an undeniable truth: Trump   will do anything to interfere with our elections again if it buys him a   victory.   For years, our president has believed he’s above the law and it’s time to   prove him wrong. [  ]We want to show Trump how many Americans now are   standing up to say this corruption has no place in the White House. Add   your name to our petition if you’re with us.                              [  ]Sign the petition   The question of impeachment has only become more urgent every day that   passes in this lawless administration.    Just the other month, Mueller testified to Congress and confirmed that   Trump is not innocent when it comes to Russian interference in the 2016   election.    This week, Trump was on live television when he asked China and Ukraine to   open an investigation into one of his political opponents.   And on Thursday night, House investigators released numerous text messages   that clearly show how senior State Department officials were involved in   leveraging a deal between the Ukrainian president’s top aide and President   Trump’s personal lawyer, that would promise a summit between their   country’s leaders in exchange for information about Biden’s son.    Since day one of his administration, Trump has made it clear that there is   nothing too immoral, too despicable, or too corrupt that he won’t do to   advance his own political agenda and personal interests. His shamelessness   has hit rock bottom. We need to let him know that nothing about committing   crimes in public makes them any less criminal.   I believe our country is rising up right now to issue that call – more   Americans than ever recognize that this will be a defining moment in our   nation’s history. I’m inspired to see more Democrats who were previously   on the fence about going forward with impeachment, stepping up to say   enough is enough – no one is above the law. And I’m proud to hear that a   record number of Americans now support going forward with impeachment.   [  ]Let’s send Trump a message that Americans aren’t standing on the   sidelines when it comes to his impeachment and saving our democracy.   Please sign our petition today so we can show Trump the numbers are   against him.   Sincerely,   Beto O’Rourke                              [  ]Sign the petition                           Contribute to Beto's campaign:  email was sent to . subject: Running for president is a marathon, not a sprint
email_content: Team --When you run for president, they tell you to treat it like a marathon, not a sprint. There are never enough hours. It's not always easy.But you run for president because you care about our nation and the people who call it home. I'm running because I love my country and know I'd bring change for every American -- not just the few people at the top -- to the Oval Office.The other thing they tell you is, well, how critical it is to raise money. That's why I want to be frank with you: we're pacing behind where we need to be for October.We're almost halfway through the month, but we're not halfway towards reaching our $3 million October fundraising goal to fund the campaign this month. Will you chip in to get us closer? campaign manager, Addisu, told the world last week that we have to raise almost $3 million -- $2,998,771 to be exact -- in October to cover our campaign expenses and continue to grow a movement that can win.Over the past eight months, I've had the opportunity to meet hardworking Americans across the nation and hear directly from them about what a better America for all should look like. I've heard from grieving parents in New Hampshire about the loss of their daughter to the opioid epidemic. This is an issue that's sweeping America and I've pledged my support to tackle the very serious problem our country is facing.I've heard from a concerned young woman in Iowa about what I'd do to bring the country together to stop the gun violence plaguing our nation. She moved to Decorah a year ago from Las Vegas after the shooting. She courageously fought through tears explaining how the shooting changed her life forever -- all while being accompanied by her eight-year-old sister.It's conversations like these that have inspired the things that I will fight for beginning on day one of entering the White House. But if that is going to become a reality, we need to get back on track for fundraising this month.I'm asking for your support, friend. subject: Not a single question about climate change. Not a single question about climate change. Not a single question about climate change.
email_content: Friend,Three hours. Dozens of questions. BUT NOT ONE SINGLE QUESTION ABOUT THE CLIMATE CRISIS.Last night, CNN, _The New York Times_, and the DNC failed us. They failed the American people, and they failed the young leaders striking and demanding action.I won't stand for it. And you shouldn't either. IT'S UP TO US TO HOLD CANDIDATES, THE PARTY, AND THE MEDIA ACCOUNTABLE RIGHT HERE RIGHT NOW-- AND I'LL USE MY MEGAPHONE TO DO JUST THAT. BUT IF I DON'T WIN THIS RE-ELECTION, I'LL LOSE THAT MEGAPHONE AND MY POSITION AS A NATIONAL LEADER ON CLIMATE.We need to fight back and be vocal right now. If you want to make sure climate stays part of the national discussion, donate to my re-election campaign today. Every donation makes a difference. Donate $1 or more right now.CONTRIBUTE!  It is unbelievable that last night the moderators had time to ask about _Ellen_ but not about our climate and our future.When DNC Chair Tom Perez refused our call for a climate debate, he said: "Beginning in 2017, I made clear to our media partners that the issue of climate change must be featured prominently in our debates. That didn't happen in 2016 -- and it was wrong." WELL, GUESS WHAT, WHEN IT COMES TO THE MOST CRITICAL ISSUES FACING ALL AMERICANS -- LAST NIGHT'S DEBATE FAILED US.The climate crisis is a foreign policy issue. It's an economic issue. It's a justice and equality issue. It's a women's issue. It's a health care issue. IT'S THE ISSUE, BECAUSE IT'S THE EXISTENTIAL CRISIS OF OUR TIME.That's why I can't for the life of me understand why the moderators did not ask even one question about it. And I'm not just disappointed -- I'm angry.If we don't show our strength, if we don't show we're united in anger about last night's "debate," I can't promise that these presidential debates will get any better or show any more interest in saving millions of lives and our planet. But I can promise that I will hold the Party, the press, and the future Democratic nominee accountable, whoever she or he may be.A donation right now before our mid-month deadline sends a message to the Party, to the media, and to the 2020 nominees that climate deserves everything we've got -- donate $1 or more right now.Very truly yours,JayCONTRIBUTE! subject: Protect access to health care
email_content: Friends--  Growing up with a working nurse as a mom, I learned early about the importance of access to good health care. That led me to become a doctor in the Army, where I treated wounded soldiers during Desert Storm. After I was discharged, I practiced pediatric neurology for more than 25 years in Norfolk.Treating sick children, and children living with disabilities, really opens your eyes to the importance of health coverage -- meaningful, affordable, quality coverage. Access to good health coverage means a patient can see a doctor before a pain or a cough turns into a major illness. Good, meaningful coverage means you can afford your medication, and that your health insurance policy actually covers the health care you need. We provided that, working in a bipartisan way, when we expanded Medicaid in 2018, providing more than 320,000 Virginians with affordable, real health coverage.But meaningful coverage is under threat from Donald Trump and legislators here in Richmond.That's why we need to secure a Democratic majority in the General Assembly on November 5.Please fight with me by chipping in $10, $25, $50 or an amount of your choice so we can flip the legislature and improve access to quality health care in Virginia.As a doctor and as governor of Virginia, I want the best health care for all Virginians. I will leave no stone unturned as I look for ways to make that happen.Thank you for your help. Let's win on November 5!Take care,RalphThis email was sent to .To unsubscribe from The Way Ahead email list, please click here.Paid for by The Way AheadThe Way AheadPO Box 597Richmond VA 23218

subject: Team Cornyn’s Day of Action: Sign Up Now!
email_content: If Democrats in Congress have shown you anything over the past month or two, it’s that they will NEVER change. As far as the leftists are concerned, Friend,Are you passionate about keeping Texas red in 2020, friend? If so, join us on Saturday, November 2 for our Team Cornyn Day of Action! We are partnering with the Abbott campaign and RPT’s Volunteer Engagement Project for this Red Alert TX event and we need your help. We will be knocking on doors to spread our conservative message, learning new digital strategies for supporting my campaign and meeting fellow volunteers in your area. My campaign will be set up at five different locations in Denton, Williamson, Harris, Tarrant, and Dallas counties to meet you. I need supporters who are willing to step up to fend off the Democrats from flipping Texas blue. Will you sign up to attend one of my events?DAY OF ACTION: SIGN UP NOW <  We must stop the Democrats from turning Texas into the next California. I need you to sign up and attend those events to show your support for our conservative values! If we don’t have many people showing up, my opponents will label our campaign as weak. Then, the media will pounce. This is your chance to make a difference. Will you help tell your fellow Texans that John Cornyn rejects Californian liberalism and instead supports the hard-working, red-blooded Americans who make our state great?   FIND YOUR DAY OF ACTION SITE <  I hope you will attend one of my Day of Action events and take a leading role on my campaign.Thank you,John Cornyn  Paid for by Texans for Senator John Cornyn, Inc.  This email was sent to  < With you on board, we’re one step closer to keeping Texas red and fighting to create a future we can all be proud of. On behalf of all of us, we’re glad you’re on board. Now that you’re on Team Cornyn, make sure that you’re keeping up to date with the latest news. The best way to do so? Following our campaign onFacebook < and Twitter < – that way you’ll always be the first to know when something important comes up. Now, if you’re still reading this, we know you’rereally ready to stand up and protect Texas. To aid your fight, we suggest you turnthis song < up on full volume and do anything you can to help stop the dangerous policies being pedaled by the left to oppose our president and replace our conservative Texas values. Once you’re pumped up and ready to go, head over to ourvolunteer page < and find out exactly how you can help. We’d be proud to have you join us. Thank you for all you do to support John Cornyn for Senate. Don’t want to receive additional updates? Click here tounsubscribe < But we’d rather you stick around. Together, we can protect this great state we know and love, and promote a safe, prosperous, and healthy Texas. Contributions to Texans for Senator John Cornyn, Inc. are not tax deductible.

subject: You can stop Chris Smith
email_content: I have dedicated my entire career to protecting human rights at home and abroad. But my work is not finished, and I cannot do this alone. And if it were up to him, he would ban abortion outright. It is time for him to pack his bags, go home to Virginia, and allow someone else to stand up and fight for our community in Washington.That is why we need your help right now: Can you commit to making a monthly donation to our campaign today? A monthly, sustained donation is a direct investment in unseating Chris Smith next year.  dangerous agenda does not have to continue. We can put a stop to it--together. subject: Just released: Tom’s plan for affordable housing in America
email_content: Read more on Tom’s Affordable Housing plan here  He fought for affordable housing during last week’s debate — make sure he can do it again in the December debate by making a donation today  we lay our head at night determines so much about our life: whether we’re surrounded by clean air and water, can provide healthy food for our families, rely on economic security, and have access to a strong education. But big corporate interests — and their corruption of our government and leaders — have turned America’s real estate industry into a $1.9 trillion business that favors the wealthy and preys on the people.For too long, the American housing market has been ballooning out of control, making the rich even richer and putting vulnerable people on the streets. subject: Happy Thanksgiving!
email_content: We have been given so much.View this email in your browser  Some perspective for this joyous time of Thanksgiving...------------------------------------------------------------Let us all remember that love and grace are God’s gifts as we gather this Thanksgiving.Despite the political rancor of the day, we have so much for which to be thankful and so much on which we can all agree.Personally, I am so thankful to live in the freest country in the world, with the Constitutional protections we’ve been given.Protections that can’t be taken away by the stroke of a pen.But, one of the things I’m most thankful for today is you.Your support has been such a source of encouragement as my campaign has gotten underway this fall.Helping to spread the word about my campaign…The generous financial support that keeps us going…And, especially the prayers of God’s people that continue to sustain me during the long, difficult days.The battle for our country, and my campaign will continue.But today, let us rest, enjoy the company of family and friends, and be thankful for all we have been given.After all, this is what it’s all about – and I’m so happy to take some time off and just focus on my family today.Have a very Happy Thanksgiving.God bless you.  God bless Texas.  God bless America.Kathleen WallContribute  Facebook  Twitter  Instagram  Website  for by Kathaleen Wall for CongressKathaleen Wall for CongressP.O. email_content: Peter --Big News: we were endorsed by Planned Parenthood Action Fund.Groups like Planned Parenthood provide critical care -- especially for folks in our rural communities who are more likely to be uninsured, poor, or forced to drive long distances to get the care they need. Steve King wants to defund Planned Parenthood, cutting access to healthcare for millions of people. As a country, we must expand healthcare coverage and rural accessibility to vital medical services.Will you join Planned Parenthood Action Fund in supporting our campaign to elect J.D. to represent Iowa’s 4th District? Chip in $5 or more today.  heard too many stories from folks in the 4th district about the difficulties of receiving quality, affordable, and accessible care. It underscores just how underserved and overlooked our communities are when it comes to healthcare services.In Manilla, a woman told us how she received her prenatal care at a Planned Parenthood. We’ve heard from others whose affordable cancer screenings from Planned Parenthood gave them the information they need to battle and beat their diagnoses. In all of Iowa in the past 15 years, 30 OB/GYN units have closed -- making Planned Parenthood even more invaluable to growing our families and ensuring their health, safety, and well-being.Steve King has gone after Planned Parenthood, blindly towing the party line and working against the needs of this district to cut funding for an organization that performs affordable check-ups, flu shots, and other routine primary and preventative medical treatments.We are proud to have the support of an organization that provides desperately-needed care to Iowa families.Peter, will you contribute $5 or more today to our campaign to make sure we have a representative who will stand tall with Planned Parenthood? subject: We can be better than this
email_content: Have you had enough of Senator Cornyn's blatant partisanship?↓Are you ready for a senator who will put Texans over party politics?↓Donate now to help elect MJ Hegar and defeat Senator Cornyn >> Peter,Mitch McConnell's Senate has done some pretty awful things in the past few years. And Senator Cornyn has been with him every step of the way. For starters, they tried to repeal the Affordable Care Act over and over again, with no plan to replace it. Had they succeeded, millions of Texans with pre-existing conditions would be at risk of losing their health care at the whims of the insurance industry.↪ Senator Cornyn was right in line with his boss Mitch McConnell, voting to repeal the Affordable Care Act 18 times -- even though Texas has the highest uninsured rate in the country! subject: The scariest thing? What he might do
email_content: This week, we will almost certainly see Donald Trump become just the third president in nearly 250 years of our republic's history to be impeached.But that's just step one.The message is clear: the only way to stop Donald Trump from abusing his office is to remove him from it.Trump treats rules, laws, and limits as annoyances for him to dodge, not instruments of fairness. His repeated invitations to foreign powers to meddle in our elections and attack his political opponents show that Trump sees democracy itself not as an ideal, but a nuisance.As dangerous as Trump's behavior has been, it pales in comparison to what he might do if he feels there are no repercussions for his actions.So we, the people, must make sure our voices are clear. This president must be impeached.JoeDONATE email was sent to .Too much email? Switch to our less email option here:     unsubscribe, go to:    for by Kennedy for Massachusetts.

subject: Every American child deserves a great public education.
email_content: Team,When I was just a baby, my parents fought very hard to move my family into a neighborhood with good public schools, which in the 1960s were often in all-white neighborhoods.It was in that town where I grew up and benefited from a world-class education, which set me on a trajectory my parents and grandparents could have only dreamed for me -- first to college, then a Rhodes scholarship, law school, and eventually elected to serve the people of Newark and New Jersey.Fifty years later, access to a high-quality public education still too often depends on the zip code a child lives in, the color of their skin, and the size of his or her family's bank account.I'm fighting to change that. My education plan calls for a high-quality public school in every community and opportunity for every child -- regardless of where they grow up.I hope you'll stand with me in advocating for our public schools to have the resources they need. If you want a president who will invest in our children's futures, add your name here. what my public education plan calls for:Making our school financing system more equitable by dramatically increasing funding for low-income schools.Giving teachers a raise by passing the RAISE Act, which would provide a refundable tax credit for all public school teachers of up to $10,000.Investing at least $200 billion in school infrastructure to ensure that all schools are in good condition and able to provide an education that prepares all students for success in the 21st-century economy.I'm also proposing that we work towards improving the diversity of our educator workforce, expanding access to quality preschool education, and supporting high-quality public charter schools as a strategy to meet the needs of all students.Sign your name if you agree that it's time to raise teacher salaries and increase funding for our public schools. American child deserves a great public education.CoryAdd your name:  for by Cory 2020P.O. Box 32009 Newark, NJ 07102 | All content © 2019 Cory 2020, All Rights Reserved.Contributions or gifts to Cory 2020 are not tax deductible.It’s time for leadership that can reignite our spirit of common purpose.
