subject: Pelosi Knows Impeachment Is Weak
email_content: "Compelling, overwhelming and bipartisan: These are the criteria Speaker Nancy Pelosi drew as she publicly announced last March that she wouldn’t..." Pelosi Knows Impeachment Is Weak------------------------------------------------------------“Compelling, overwhelming and bipartisan: These are the criteria Speaker Nancy Pelosi drew as she publicly announced last March that she wouldn’t support impeachment. Back then she claimed impeaching the president with anything less would be divisive and irresponsible,” Rep. Doug Collins R-GA writes in The Wall Street Journal.“Ten months later, however, Mrs. Pelosi has transmitted two articles of impeachment that fail to meet any of her criteria, let alone those of the Founders.”The facts are clear: The Senate must “reject the temptation of partisan impeachment and expeditiously acquit the president.”Click here to read more.  the Senate begins the impeachment trial of President Trump, it faces the challenge not just of weighing the charges, but of trying to rescue the entire process from the low political farce that the House has made of it,” the New York Post  editorial board writes.House Democrats’ sham impeachment has been “politics at its worst and opens the door, as some of the Founders warned, for ‘normalizing’ impeachment.” Speaker Pelosi “summed up the true motives of Democrats when she said that regardless of what the Senate does, impeachment will be a ‘permanent stain’ on President Trump’s legacy. In fact, the stain will be on Democrats,” Cal Thomas writes in The Washington Times  .Stat of the day: On the heels of President Trump’s historic Phase 1 trade deal with China, and “according to a monthly poll from agricultural trade publication Farm Journal released Sunday, 83% of farmers and ranchers approve of the president’s job performance,” Kirk Maltais reports for The Wall Street Journal  .Privacy Policy  | Contact the White House  | Unsubscribe  White House . 1600 Pennsylvania Ave NW . subject: Four things you need to know about Joe

He has championed legislation in Congress to repeal the Hyde Amendment to ensure that low-income people have access to abortion care, including through any future Medicare for All legislation.3. He has been a strong and early federal advocate for the ROE Act, a state law that would break down barriers to abortion access in Massachusetts.4. He has been a strong advocate for maternal health care for every pregnant person, including those most at risk and most in need; including improving access to postpartum care through Medicaid. Joe believes every woman -- and pregnant person -- deserves full bodily autonomy. It's time to codify Roe v. Wade into law. subject: About lowering prescription drug costs...
email_content: 2017: “We should implement legal reforms that protect patients and doctors from unnecessary costs that drive up the price of insurance – and work to bring down the artificially high price of drugs and bring them down immediately.”2018: “One of my greatest priorities is to reduce the price of prescription drugs. [...] That is why I have directed my administration to make fixing the injustice of high drug prices one of my top priorities for the year. And prices will come down substantially, watch.”2019: “[...] I am asking the Congress to pass legislation that finally takes on the problem of global freeloading and delivers fairness and price transparency for American patients.”Team,Every year, Trump makes and breaks the same promises over and over again.No one in our community, no American, deserves to be crushed under the weight of medical debt. subject: Thank you for your incredible support
email_content: [ Andrew ]Andrew Yang for President Yang Gang -- Thank you for your incredible support these past months.  You all have uplifted me and inspired me and Evelyn and this campaign at every turn.  Your passion and energy.  Your donations and hundreds of thousands of hours of calling and volunteering.  Your enthusiasm, dedication and commitment. We have accomplished so much together.  We have brought a message of Humanity First and a vision of an economy and society that works for us and our families to millions of our fellow Americans. We went from a mailing list that started with just my Gmail contact list to receiving donations from over 430,000 people and support from millions more across the country. One of the things I’m most proud of -- we gave $1,000 a month for a year to 13 families across the country. We highlighted the real problems in our communities as our economy is being transformed before our eyes by technology and automation.  We stood on the debate stage and shifted our national conversation to include the fourth industrial revolution, a topic no one wanted to touch. Our signature proposal, Universal Basic Income, has become part of the mainstream conversation.  We increased the popular support for Universal Basic Income to 66% of Democrats and 72% among voters 18-34. And without a doubt, we accelerated the eradication of poverty in our society by years, perhaps even generations, And that is thanks to all of YOU! Though thousands of voters came out for our campaign tonight in New Hampshire, it is not the outcome we fought so hard for.  It is bitterly disappointing for many of us. But it should not be. Every single day I’ve had supporters say to me: “Your campaign helped me out of a depression.  Thank you.” “Working on this campaign has made me a better human being.” “I met my significant other because of you.” “Your campaign brought my family together.  Your campaign got me excited about politics for the first time.” These are all things that people have said to me in the past days.  I’m incredibly proud of this campaign.  We have touched and improved millions of lives and moved this country we love so much in the right direction. And while there is great work left to be done, I am the MATH guy.  And it is clear tonight from the numbers that we are not going to win this race.  I am not someone who wants to accept donations and support in a race that we will not win. And so tonight, I am suspending my campaign for president. This is not an easy decision.  Endings are hard and I’ve always intended to stay in this race until the very end.  But I have been convinced that the message of this campaign will not be strengthened by my staying in this race any longer. Endings are hard.  But this is not an ending. This is a beginning. This is the starting line.  This campaign has awakened something fundamental in this country and ourselves. We’ve outlasted over a dozen senators, governors, and members of Congress and become the most exciting force in this entire race. The Yang Gang has fundamentally shifted the direction of this country and transformed our politics, and we are only continuing to grow. My goal when I first started was always to solve the problems that got Donald Trump elected.  And I know in order to do that, I will support whoever is the Democratic nominee.  That said, I hope this campaign can be a message, and word of caution, to all of my Democratic colleagues. Donald Trump is not the cause of all of our problems.  He is a symptom.  We must cure the disease that got him elected, and in order to do that we must address the real problems that affect our people and offer solutions to actually solve them. Those solutions are bold, and many think they are crazy.  But I hope my campaign has made it a little less crazy to think we can lead our country to eradicate poverty.  In fact, five candidates in this field have already supported it or expressed openness to supporting Universal Basic Income. I stand before you today and say that while we did not win this election, we are just getting started. This is the beginning. This movement is the future of American politics. This movement is the future of the Democratic party. This wave is just beginning and it will continue to build until we rewrite the rules of this economy to work for us, the people of this country. Thank you to each and every person who made this campaign possible, I love and appreciate you.  Being your candidate has been the privilege of my life.  We will continue to do the work and move this country forward. Thank you all.  God bless you.  And God bless the United States of America. -AndrewPaid for by Friends of Andrew Yang

subject: What you saw tonight
email_content: Before you log off for the night, let me just say this:Even though you saw a lot of spirited back and forth on the debate stage tonight, the reality is, every candidate agrees on the set of problems we desperately need to fix in this country. We all agree that our health care system isn’t working for the vast majority of people, that corporations have a dangerous amount of sway in Washington, that we need to act now to save our dying planet, and that we must defeat Donald Trump in November. That’s common ground for all of us. But I disagree with many of the solutions that the other candidates are putting forward to solve these problems. The solution isn’t to put the government in charge of large parts of our economy. The solution isn’t to force people to give up a union-negotiated health care plan that works for them, as Senator Sanders and Senator Warren propose. Unchecked capitalism has failed, but we still need a competitive, dynamic private sector — one that’s regulated with fair and just parameters — to actualize a government that’s truly of, by, and for the people.And here’s one other thing I want to tell you: I am absolutely committed to fighting for the values I talked about on stage tonight. My heart is in these issues, and if yours is too, volunteer to reach out to potential voters in South Carolina before their primary on Saturday.  is not the time to take a step back. Let’s show the rest of the country that we’re bringing change all the way to the White House.— Tom Tom  you for being a part of this campaign! email_content: Peter,The economic impact of the reactions to the coronavirus will certainly be disruptive and perhaps significant. Sports arenas have shut down. Amusement parks, movie theaters, schools, churches -- all closing. Businesses will be affected and nearly every individual in the country on some level will be impacted.While the nation focuses on COVID-19 the coronavirus and rightly so, what’s happening with the presidential election campaign < was just two weeks ago that Bernie Sanders seemed to be the heavy favorite to win the Democratic nomination for President. Well, not anymore. Things can change quickly in politics... and in life.South Carolina proved to be the big win Joe Biden needed, and three days later, that momentum pushed him to victories in most of the Super Tuesday states. A week later, he won most of the states again. Looking at the states yet to vote, pundits agree it would take a minor miracle for anyone but Joe Biden to be the eventual nominee.It seems that Democrats have turned away from Bernie Sanders and the socialist option he was championing. subject: You deserve an explanation
email_content: FriendsWe are just a few days away from the first end-of-quarter deadline of 2020. Now, I know that with all that's happening right now, our FEC deadline is probably not at the top of your list of things to pay attention to. That's why I want to give you an explanation of why it's so important we raise $10,000 before March 31st.New York's 24th Congressional District is one of our best chances to expand our House majority -- it's one of only three districts still held by a Republican despite Hillary Clinton winning here in 2016. The only way we'll be able to work toward a progressive agenda in Congress is to win districts like this.So please, will you make a donation towards our $10,000 end-of-quarter fundraising goal? Any amount would be a huge help.Chip In →  Republican opponent, Congressman John Katko, has failed central New York for far too long. It's never been more clear that we deserve representation that will listen to real people -- not special interests and the rich and powerful.I will be the Congressman our district deserves. I promise I will not let you down.If you can, dig deep, and make a donation to our campaign today. Reaching our $10,000 end-of-quarter goal will show Katko and the GOP that we are prepared to flip this seat.

subject: ?WATCH: President Trump sends USNS Comfort to New York
email_content: The USNS Comfort arrived in New York today three weeks ahead of schedule, to begin treating patients tomorrow to help relieve the city’s hospitals. White House • March 30, 2020** ?WATCH: President Trump sends USNS Comfort to New York------------------------------------------------------------ USNS Comfort arrived in New York Harbor today three weeks ahead of schedule, where it will begin treating patients tomorrow to help relieve the city’s hospital capacity.President Trump visited Naval Station Norfolk in Virginia over the weekend, seeing off the hospital ship as it embarked for New York City.“I’m here to express my profound gratitude to the dedicated service members who will soon be on the frontlines of this fight,” he said.“This great ship behind me is a 70,000-ton message of hope and solidarity to the incredible people of New York—a place I know very well, a place I love. We’re here for you, we’re fighting for you, and we are with you all the way, and we always will be.”Watch the USNS Comfort arrive in New York City!  President Trump extends Coronavirus Guidelines through April 30------------------------------------------------------------Speaking from the Rose Garden last night, President Trump thanked Americans for their selflessness in helping contain the spread of Coronavirus over the past few weeks. These efforts have saved—and will continue to save—countless American lives.“You’re making the difference,” he said.The President also shared news from the public health experts on his White House Coronavirus Task Force. Modeling put together by Dr. Deborah Birx and Dr. Anthony Fauci suggest that the nationwide mitigation measures put in place may be significantly reducing the number of new infections and the number of fatalities from Coronavirus.President Trump: On this National Doctors Day, America is grateful!  a result, “the modeling estimates that the peak in death rate is likely to hit in two weeks,” President Trump said. “Nothing would be worse than declaring victory before the victory is won. That would be the greatest loss of all.”To keep this momentum going in slowing the spread of Coronavirus, the President is extending his nationwide Coronavirus Guidelines  through April 30.“I want every citizen in our country to take heart and confidence in the fact that we have the best medical minds in the world tackling this disease. We have the best science, the best researchers, and the best talent anywhere working night and day to protect your family and loved ones and to overcome this pandemic.”On Friday, President Trump signed bipartisan legislation to provide emergency relief to American families and workers during the global Coronavirus outbreak.The unprecedented relief package totals more than $2 trillion, including $100 billion for healthcare providers, tax-free direct payments to qualifying American families, and $350 billion in partially forgivable loans for small businesses and nonprofits.Read the full transcript of yesterday’s White House Coronavirus briefing.  MORE: President Trump signs unprecedented economic relief bill  Photo of the Day------------------------------------------------------------President Trump salutes the USNS Comfort as she departs Naval Air Station Norfolk Pier 8 in Virginia en route to New York City | March 28, 2020Privacy Policy  | Contact the White House  | Unsubscribe  White House . 1600 Pennsylvania Ave NW . Washington, DC 20500 . USA · 202-456-1111

subject: What’s on your mind?
email_content: I’m worried.I’ll be honest with you — this crisis is unlike anything we’ve ever experienced in American history.COVID-19 has changed the way we live and will continue to impact us for an uncertain amount of time. It has especially hurt working-class families, unprotected workers, brown and black people, and those who have already been neglected by our country’s broken safety net.My heart goes out to anyone who’s unemployed, putting their life on the line at work, struggling to make ends meet, or scared of what the future holds.The only way we’re going to get through this is together. Especially now in light of this crisis, we are determined to make sure that our leaders represent the people’s interests and support those who are hurting the most in this crisis.Can you share with me what’s most important to you and your family? I want to know your worries and make sure our campaign understands what are the most urgent issues people face in the time of COVID-19. [ the survey [ fight for big, progressive change has never been more important.Now more than ever, we deserve a government whose main goal is to preserve and protect the people, not the entrenched bureaucracy that comes with political apathy.The new challenges we face reaffirm a poignant truth: it’s time to change our politics. We need a leader who understands the issues people face and the priorities families in your community have.Will you take our People’s Priorities Survey and let us know what issues matter most to you and why? subject: Some news
email_content: Hey, I hope you and your loved ones are staying safe during this difficult time. My team and I are working to adjust our strategy amid this new reality and continue our work to save Minnesota’s Senate seat. With that in mind, I wanted to share some news:Nate Silver’s FiveThirtyEight recently released an analysis giving Democrats new hope that we have what it takes to flip the Senate.While Republicans kicked off the election cycle with the upper hand, Democrats in key Senate races across the country are surging in the polls and outraising their GOP opponents.We currently hold the advantage when it comes to pick-up opportunities in states like Arizona, Colorado, North Carolina, Maine — and holding strong here in Minnesota, Michigan, New Hampshire, and more.That’s all thanks to grassroots supporters like you who have helped put Democrats like me on the path to victory. But with a few months left to go until Election Day, there is still a lot that can change — in our race and others.Senate control could go either way, which means we must capitalize on our momentum. Can you pitch in $10 or more to help us save Minnesota’s Senate seat and take back the majority? Thanks in advance.Contribute now:  Republicans are seeing the same reports we’re seeing. That’s why their super PACs and mega-donors are dumping millions into key Senate races to defeat Democrats. We can’t let them get away with it.With your help, I know we won’t. I’ve seen what this incredible team is capable of in moments like these and I’m confident that if all of us come together, we can flip the Senate.Thank you for anything you’re able to chip in, but if you can’t afford to give today — that’s okay! Taking care of yourself and your loved ones are the most important things you can do right now. I’m just thankful to have you on our team.— TinaP.S. I understand how difficult this time is for many of you and your families. subject: Facts
email_content: I couldn't be more grateful to have you by my side as our grassroots campaign continues to grow. But we also can't ignore the facts:If the rest of the map stays the same, Donald Trump can lose Pennsylvania, Michigan, and Wisconsin, but if he wins Minnesota, he wins re-election. That’s basically the whole ballgame.Look, Trump only lost Minnesota by one and a half points. That makes our state one of his top targets this year, and he won’t let us slip through his fingers again. Super PACs supporting him dumped millions into Minnesota in 2018, and the Trump campaign has already pledged to spend millions more this time around.This is a must-win seat if Democrats are going to take back the Senate majority, and it’s a must-win state if we’re going to get Trump out of the White House. But we've got an expensive fight on our hands. So, I’m asking:If it makes sense for you financially, can you chip in just $10 to help us hold strong in Minnesota? Our end-of-month deadline is coming up in just a few days, which means we don’t have a lot of time left to hit our grassroots goal for April. You can donate right here:Contribute now:  can’t thank you enough for everything you do for our campaign. With your help, we’ll make sure Trump doesn’t flip Minnesota red.All my best,Tina---Paid for by Tina Smith for MinnesotaTina Smith for MinnesotaPO Box 14362St. Paul, MN 55114United States unsubscribe:   Contributions or gifts to Tina Smith for Minnesota are not tax-deductible.Privacy Policy:

subject: A message for you about our important April fundraising goal
email_content: Our country is going through a difficult time right now -- and Elizabeth has been busy.In the past month, she's helped lead the charge for an Essential Workers Bill of Rights, fought to put people first as we get through this crisis, shined a light on the Trump administration's failures of leadership, and endorsed 20 terrific Democratic candidates up and down the ballot.She's still in this fight, but she can't do it alone. As Warren Democrats, we need to fight by her side.Together, we can fill our government with more leaders who will fight for our progressive values. We can keep the voices of working people front and center as we recover from this crisis and rebuild our country. And we can make bold, inclusive reform to address the root causes of how we got into this mess.We only have three more days left to hit our April fundraising goal and fully fund our outreach for May. We understand that with everything else happening, not everyone is going to be able to make a financial contribution to this movement right now.But if you're in a place where you're able to donate, a contribution of $2 or anything you can would go a long way -- to keep growing our movement, to elect Democrats like Elizabeth, and to fight for big, structural change. is the most important election of our lifetimes, and we need all hands on deck.This year, we need to send Donald Trump packing, keep the House, take back the Senate, and elect state legislators and governors who'll keep Republicans from gerrymandering themselves into power after next year's redistricting.The fight won't be over in November -- we'll need to keep working to end corruption and make our government work for everyone -- but we also can't wait until November.So we'll keep advocating day in and day out for the pandemic relief measures we desperately need today, and we'll make sure we elect Democrats up and down the ballot to see this crisis through for working families. Side by side, we'll root out corruption in government and put power in the hands of the people.We're building a powerful organizing network to get this done -- but it takes real resources. It's going to take a grassroots movement funded by grassroots donors like you.If you can, please make a contribution before Thursday's monthly fundraising deadline -- so we can hit our goal for April and hit the ground running in May. for everything, and stay safe,Warren DemocratsDONATE NOW:  for by Warren Democrats____________________________________________All content © 2020 Warren Democrats, All Rights ReservedPO Box 171375, Boston, MA 02117____________________________________________This email was sent to .To unsubscribe, go to:

subject: Emergency rental assistance for Rhode Islanders
email_content: Your daily Rhode Island COVID-19 update  Hello friend, This crisis is hitting those who can least afford it the hardest. There are many folks out there who are finding themselves in difficult financial positions and are worried about paying their bills and affording a place to live. No one should have to worry about this right now. Today, I want to tell you about our new emergency rental assistance program to help Rhode Islanders get through this crisis. To stay up to date with Rhode Island's latest COVID-19 statistics, please check the Department of Health's new data dashboard for all the information you need about the spread of coronavirus in Rhode Island. I’m proud to announce that we have $1.5 million in emergency rental assistance available to low-income renters who have been impacted by the COVID-19 emergency and are at immediate risk of homelessness. Those who qualify can receive a grant of up to $5,000 to support past due rent payments and other fees. It's important to emphasize that this is for people who are already behind on their rent due as a result of COVID-19. It's my hope that this fund will allow us to alleviate the burden of the low-income workers who have been hit hardest by this crisis. Starting today, you can go to HousingHelpRI.com to view the requirements and apply. If you don’t have consistent access to the internet and have questions about the application process, you can call the United Way at 211 for more help. This crisis is also affecting homeowners in Rhode Island, and so I also want to remind everyone that more than 20 financial institutions in RI have signed a pledge that provides relief to residential borrowers. All of the participating institutions are listed on the DBR website. As a reminder, they’re offering: A 90-day grace period for all residential mortgage payments for individuals impacted by COVID-19, with the opportunity to request additional relief An agreement to not report late payments to credit reporting agencies for residential borrowers who take advantage of this relief  A 60-day moratorium on initiating residential foreclosures and evictions; and An agreement to waive mortgage-related late fees.  This is a perfect example of people stepping up to do the right thing and help others in a time of need. That’s what’s going to get us through this crisis. We’ve all had to sacrifice through this crisis in big ways and small ways, and I know that it's becoming more and more challenging every day to continue social distancing. We all miss seeing our friends and our extended families. However, we need to keep going. If we do, we’re going to be in a better place to move along with our reopening, and throughout the summer we’ll be able to safely get together with the people we love and miss. But we’re not there yet. Please, do the right thing and continue to follow the stay at home order.  -Gina Raimondo Governor P.S.: Information is our greatest weapon in the fight against COVID-19, If you or someone you know wants to sign up to receive these emails, you can use this link. Governor's Office | 82 Smith Street, Providence, RI 02903 Unsubscribe  Update Profile | About Constant Contact Sent by communications@governor.ri.gov in collaboration with Try email marketing for free today!

subject: It’s time for Congress to protect consumers in the next COVID relief bill
email_content: Peter,Since mid-March, over 30 million Americans have filed for unemployment.I want you to pause for a moment and think about that: more than 30 million people are currently out of work, and yet they’re expected to pay their bills in full and on time as if we’re not all living through a dire financial crisis. Americans are being told to stay home for the sake of slowing the spread of COVID-19, and the federal government has a responsibility to ensure that we can all remain safe and financially secure while doing so.If you agree that Congress must provide quick relief to Americans grappling with a pandemic that’s costing millions of jobs and has made it tougher to pay the bills, will you add your name today?  HERE  leaders can cancel rent payments. They can pause all payments of debts that consumers are unable to cover during the crisis and ensure that no American incurs interest, late fees, or other penalties for nonpayment. They can protect stimulus payments from debt collectors, and once this crisis ends, they can call on creditors to give people enough time to catch up on missed payments. It’s possible -- we just need to demand that our leaders fight for us.It’s going to be a long road to recovery, but Congress has the power to ease this burden on working and middle-class families everywhere: Join me today in demanding they do their job by enacting protections for consumers in the next COVID relief package. subject: Great government service continues
email_content: From Day One, Governor Holcomb has made providing great government service one of his pillars in leading Indiana – and that commitment continues today  <> Friends, There’s no doubt that some things have changed over the last few months – but one thing remains constant:Governor Holcomb and your state’s commitment to great government service for ALL Hoosiers. And that means ALL Hoosiers…including our most vulnerable, our motorists, and anyone needing emergency medical help.  Department of Child Services The Indiana Department of Child Services is continuing its work on the frontlines advancing its critical mission of protecting Indiana’s at-risk children. While some work has moved virtual – if there’s an allegation of child abuse or neglect, a family case manager is visiting in-person to investigate. But that’s where we need your help. If you suspect a child is being harmed, please place a call at anytime to the state’s Child Abuse & Neglect Hotline at 1-800-800-5556. As schools and many community activities have closed, calls to the hotline have dropped by more than 40% -- but sadly, children are still at risk.  Bureau of Motor Vehicles The Indiana Bureau of Motor Vehicles is now open by appointment and is ready to help you with important services – like knowledge testing, a new vehicle registration, a new driver’s license, a replacement license and more. Just last week, the BMV served Hoosiers with 141,854 appointments, and they’re adding an additional 2,000 appointments a day to better serve you. Check here < to make an appointment, and to see if you can complete your transaction online. And remember – Governor Holcomb has ordered an extension on all license and registration expiration dates through June 4. Emergency Medical Services This is National EMS Week – and a great reminder to thank those medical professionals who are ALWAYS on the frontlines serving us! From Day One, Governor Holcomb has made providing great government service one of his pillars in leading Indiana – and that commitment continues today. #INThisTogether,-Your Holcomb Crew   Paid for by Eric Holcomb for Indiana. © Copyright 2020. All rights reserved.  Eric Holcomb for Indiana, 101 W Ohio Street, Suite 2200, Indianapolis, IN 46204 | 317 569-0709  This email was sent to        Unsubscribe <

subject: we're grateful for your support
email_content: Derek,It's the end of the month, and you're probably getting quite a few end-of-month appeals from causes you care about. I'm going to ask you to consider supporting Mark Warner's re-election campaign, and I'd like to explain why. First, I want to thank everyone who has made a donation -- this week, this month, this quarter. Thank you for showing your continued support for Mark and for this entire team. After the Republican primary in June, we'll know who will face Mark in the November general election, and our work will kick into high gear. Our team is already buckling down to keep Mark in the Senate, where he's working hard for every Virginian. In moments of uncertainty, we need people like Mark, who are willing to roll up their sleeves and work until the job is done. He is fighting to make sure bi-partisan relief packages benefit Main Street over Wall Street, calling on internet service providers to expand access and remove restrictive broadband caps for rural Virginians, and laying the groundwork to make sure that everyone has the ability to safely cast their vote come November. We haven't been able to have an in-person event in almost three months, and our team is working tirelessly to give folks the opportunity to engage online with virtual town halls and digital organizing opportunities. Our fundraising has understandably slowed down, and we're working hard to make up the difference so we can press forward and spread Mark's message to folks across the Commonwealth. We need your help. I know that many folks in Virginia and around the country are facing hardship right now, but I'm asking that you consider supporting real leadership in Washington if you have the means.Any amount you can give today will help get us closer to meeting our June fundraising goal -- every dollar makes an impact. subject: Equal pay for equal work
email_content: Peter -- It's 2020 -- the wage gap should not be something women have to worry about.But still, women's work is valued less than the equivalent work from a man.In 2020, women are paid about 82 cents for every dollar a man is. And it's worse for Black women and Hispanic women, who on average are paid 62 cents and 54 cents, respectively, for their work compared to a man's $1.The Equal Pay Act was passed 57 years ago -- and it's time for us to do something to actually honor the mission of the act.In Congress, Christy would advocate for enforcement measures and accountability regarding the wage gap to make sure every worker is paid the same wage for the same work, regardless of their gender identity, race, religion, sexual orientation, age, or any other difference. Equal pay for equal work should not be a question or a debate any longer -- it is a right we need and deserve. If you agree, add your name to Christy's petition calling for the enforcement of the Equal Pay Act now >>ADD YOUR NAME >>  the wage gap still exists in 2020 is unacceptable -- and we must work hard now to make sure future generations of workers do not receive different wages for the equivalent work. That this is even a discussion we have to have is ridiculous. It's time to do right by millions of women and close the wage gap once and for all.Sign on to Christy's petition calling for the closing of the wage gap. It's time >>  for stepping up and taking action.-- Team ChristyChristy Smith is a community leader from CA-25 who has fought for her neighbors on the school board and in the California state legislature. Now she needs our help to defeat Mike Garcia and flip this battleground House seat blue in November. subject: ACTION: Make your voice heard on SB 463
email_content: Hi friend,During the primary elections, Georgians faced up to 8-hour lines and thousands of absentee ballots that were never received. Depending on where a person lives in Georgia, their access to this fundamental right differs, and that is unacceptable. The Secretary of State is not taking responsibility and choosing to blame under-resourced county officials and under-trained poll workers, but the Georgia Constitution makes clear that the buck stops with the Secretary of State. He is the chief election official, and it is his job to make sure that every Georgian has the right to vote without undue burden. That's the job he asked for. That's the job he's got. Therefore, Secretary of State Brad Raffensperger must fix the problem immediately - before millions of Georgians face hours in line, risk COVID-19 exposure, unsent absentee ballots, and uncertainty about whether their votes will count.Raffensperger said he wanted difficult voting experiences to be one in a billion and that no Georgian should have to wait more than 30 minutes to vote. If that's what he wants, he must take steps to make this a reality. He has failed to provide counties with the resources and training to meet the standard he set. Right now, the Secretary of State has proposed legislation, Senate Bill 463, that does the exact opposite.  ●Every County Is On Its Own: SB 463 changes the law to say that the State Election Board - responsible for oversight - no longer has to actually do its job. The bill will instead make it each county's problem, without the necessary training, funding, or support.  Rather than taking steps to reduce lines, the bill will tell every Georgian that they only get the democracy their county can afford.  For rural counties, our largest area, this means we will see a WORSENING of the current problems in Georgia, where democracy looks different depending on which county you live in.  The state should be supporting counties, not hanging them out to dry, so voters have equal access to the vote.  ●Guess Where You Vote: SB 463 fails to properly notify voters of polling locations changes, which will lead to longer lines and more provisional ballots if voters go to the wrong location. Due to COVID-19, locations may not be available. Voters should not be penalized, and if the law does not mandate notification, too many Georgia voters will be forced to risk missing the election altogether.●Defacto ID Requirement: SB 463 enacts a new ID provision, that could turn into a de facto ID requirement whereby voters must have access to printers to mail copies of their ID to ensure their ballots are not rejected. This new provision may cause more absentee ballots to be rejected because of the new rules, which will lead to longer lines as voters who requested ballots have to vote in person. This provision goes in the WRONG direction.●Not Enough Equipment: SB 463 fails to mandate the appropriate number of machines at each polling location and fails to ensure enough check-in stations, all of which lead to longer lines as people have to wait in crowded lines, increasing their risk of illness or losing their right to vote. ●Too Risky To Vote In Person: SB 463 fails to expand access to vote by mail, which will lead to longer lines. Georgia saw an unprecedented number of voters use vote-by-mail. This keeps those who can vote from home safe AND it protects brave poll workers, the disabled, those with language barriers, the displaced, and those who could not send in their ballots. The more folks who vote from home, the safer it is for those who have no choice but to vote in person. We NEED YOUR HELP TO FIX THIS VERY BAD BILL AND NOT LET THE SECRETARY OF STATE PASS THE BUCK TO COUNTIES & CAUSE MORE PROBLEMS. EVERY VOTER IN GEORGIA MUST BE PROTECTEDTHIS IS HOW YOU CAN HELP: Call David Ralston NOW and tell him to FIX SB 463: 404-656-5020 #gapolCall House Government Affairs Chairman, Shaw Blackmon and tell him to FIX SB 463: 404.463.7853 #gapol-------This email was sent to .To unsubscribe, go to:  for by Fair Fight Action

subject: Introducing Our New Campaign Manager
email_content: WelcomeLeah Garrett to the Campaign!Hi Friend!My name is Leah Garrett, and I’m excited to introduce myself as Pat’s new campaign manager. Pat’s campaign is showing real momentum after the primary. I’m ready to lead the effort to build on the energy you have created in order for this campaign to defeat Jackie Walorski in November.The 2nd District needs a formidable leader who consistently shows up, is prepared, understands your concerns, and works to improve the quality of life for you and all Hoosiers.That’s why I believe Pat needs to be the next member of Congress for Indiana-02. Her nearly forty years of service in this district as attorney, teacher, and small business owner uniquely prepare her for this role. I look forward to serving you, the voters of this district, as Pat’s campaign manager to make sure every voter in this district hears Pat’s message of Dignity and Justice for All.STAND WITH ME →  MePrior to joining Pat’s campaign, I worked on Amy Klobuchar’s presidential campaign in both New Hampshire and Arkansas leading teams of staffers and volunteers to build the on-the-ground campaign structure, organize events with Amy, and conduct voter outreach. In 2018, I was a Regional Field Director for the Virginia Democratic Party, where I oversaw field efforts in 27 counties.I also attended the George Washington University’s Graduate School of Political Management where I received a Master’s in Political Management and Electoral Politics.The main lesson I’ve learned throughout my experience in politics is that it’s critical to understand why people care about their community and why they participate in democracy.June 30th is the all important end of quarter deadline where numbers raised will be noted by national organizations watching this race since winning the primary. Please consider making an investment right now to send the message that this is a people-powered campaign. Anything you’re able to give helps tremendously.  NOW →  $25 IMMEDIATELY →  excited to get to know you during this campaign. If you have any questions, please feel free to reply to this email.In solidarity,Leah GarrettCampaign Manager DONATE NOW  Facebook  Instagram  Twitter  Website  Hackett is a lifelong advocate for her community. subject: This Fourth of July
email_content: [                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           ‌Peter,Happy Independence Day. I hope you have a relaxing and safe holiday, spending quality time with loved ones. This year Stacy and I will spend the holiday at home, watching fireworks on TV, along with thousands of other Hoosiers.This Fourth of July comes at a difficult time for our country. Hoosiers -- and Americans -- have not yet recovered from the public health crisis, or the economic crisis, that is the coronavirus pandemic. We are also experiencing a new civil rights era, triggered by a national reckoning with systemic anti-Black racism in the wake of the killings of George Floyd, Dreasjon Reed, and others by police.Our country isn’t perfect; it takes work to make it the place it could be. Show your patriotism by taking actions to improve this country, like donating to charity, engaging in community service, peacefully protesting against injustice, or voting for candidates and policies that will help people.This Independence Day, we remember and celebrate the promise of what America should strive to be.Thank you for all that you do,Dr. Woody MyersDONATE [ subject: This Week: our new mailer, interviews, Shaheen on taxes, and more
email_content: 96 Entrepreneur. Veteran. Conservative. Contact Us Volunteer Campaign MailerEffort Targets 100,000 New Hampshire HouseholdsOur campaign launchedits first direct mail piece this week, targeting 100,000 Republican andundeclared voters.The brochure, headlined by “RESTORING AMERICANLIBERTY & PROSPERITY,” includes Corky’s bio and his positions on theeconomy, border security, protecting First and Second Amendment rights,and fiscal responsibility, among other issues. It also featuresPresident Donald Trump’s endorsement.The mailer urges voters torequest absentee ballots via the Secretary of State’s office for thosewho are concerned about COVID-19 and in-person voting in the Septemberprimary and November general election.In the News New Hampshire Public Radio’s The Exchangekicked off a weekly meet-the-candidates series July 10 with aninterview with Corky, hosted by Peter Biello. Click here to hear Corky’s take on recentsocial unrest, healthcare and more.Corky also visited last week withJack Heath, on NH Today, to chat about President Trump’s endorsement,the COVID-19 pandemic and much more. Tune in! Why Won’tSenator Shaheen Take a Stand on Broad-Based Taxes?Last week, Corkycalled on U.S. Senator Jeanne Shaheen to publicly take a stand on thequestion of an income or sales tax in New Hampshire. The decades-olddebate about broad-based taxes is heating up with Governor ChrisSununu’s recent veto of House Bill 712 passed by theDemocrat-controlled New Hampshire House and Senate -- a bill that theGovernor considers an income tax. “Democrats and Republicans are onceagain talking about ‘the Pledge’ and whether an income or sales tax isan economic necessity or political ploy,” said Corky. “As our mostsenior elected Democrat official, Senator Shaheen is in effect the headof the state’s Democrat Party, and as such, she owes it to her partyand all Granite Staters to make clear whether or not she favors a stateincome tax.“But as is her pattern, Senator Shaheen hangs to therear on critical issues, and when the dust settles, she claims she wasfor the winning side all along, whichever side that might be. That’swhat she calls being a ‘moderate.’ That’s what I call being politicallyexpedient.”Every New Hampshire governor, Democrat or Republican,has taken “The Pledge” opposing a sales and income tax, with oneexception: in seeking her third term as governor, Jeanne Shaheenrefused to do so. While she did win re-election, her support of astatewide sales tax was defeated.“With our economy here in NewHampshire still reeling from the effects of pandemic closures andrestrictions, you might expect our elected officials to come down onthe side of taxpayers, and reject any and all attempts to burden uswith income and sales taxes, whether you call them that or not,” saidCorky. “The last thing our residents and business owners need right nowis another economic hit.”Corky Continues to Meet with Granite StatersThe campaign is picking up momentum and support, as Corky takes hismessage to voters across New Hampshire. He has met with GOP groups inWindham/Derry, appeared at the Salem Chamber of Commerce's EconomicDevelopment Breakfast, and continues to talk with Granite Staters abouttheir concerns at every opportunity, in person or via Zoom or FacebookLive events. In the weeks leading up to the September primary, you canbe sure Corky will continue to reach out and share his message ofindividual liberty and economic freedom.Shaheen’s First TV Ad BringsStrong ResponseCorky last week shared his response to U.S. SenatorJeanne Shaheen’s first campaign ad, a television spot focused on NewHampshire opioid crisis."My dad battled with an addiction to opioids,so I know firsthand the pain and challenges it brings to people andtheir families," said Corky. "No one will be a bigger champion for thiscause than me in Washington.""However, it’s no surprise that D.C.Jeanne Shaheen’s first ad of the cycle tries to put distance betweenherself and her party. The fact is, though, no matter how hard shetries, she can’t run from the swamp she has immersed herself in. TheSenator is the head of the Democratic Party in New Hampshire. A partythat nationally has been overrun by the likes of Bernie Sanders, AOC,and Ilhan Omar. A party that today wants to make our streets less safe,that wants to tear down our political system and replace our economywith socialism."Corky concluded: "She cares more about pleasing‘The Squad’ than she does about getting New Hampshire families back towork. No slick ad contrived by her political machine will be able tomask who she is and who pulls her strings."The Corky Store is NowOpen!The for Senate store is NOW OPEN - have you checked it out yet? Showeveryone you support Corky by getting your official campaign shirttoday, and be sure to check back regularly, since we’ll be adding toour selection in the weeks to come. subject: Saturday Recap: Beaches, Businesses, and the Future
email_content: Your RI COVID-19 News Update  Hello friend, This was our first week holding only one press conference a week. If you weren't able to catch it on Wednesday afternoon, don't worry.There's a lot going on these days, and it's easy to miss things. That's why I wanted to put together a quick recap for you of the new announcements from the past week.   I'll still be sending out these emails every day so that you can get the most recent info when you need it. If you know someone who wants to stay up-to-date on the latest measures Rhode Island is taking to stop the spread of COVID-19, send them this link: lp.constantcontactpages.com/su/eYMG9tf. The better we stay informed, the better we'll be able to keep ourselves, our families, and our friends safe from COVID-19. BEACHES Effective this past Thursday, parking lots at Misquamicut and Scarborough State Beaches will be reduced to 25% capacity to reduce the volume of visitors. I’m sorry that we have to do this, but it’s necessary. Crowding at our beaches last weekend was the worst we’ve seen it since this crisis began, and that spilled over into crowding at local restaurants and bars. If we want to stay open, we need to stay safe.   We’ll be working with municipalities to crack down on illegal parking around our beaches and we’ll increase enforcement at local businesses. We’ll also have staff on the beaches to hand out masks to folks who don’t have them. If we start to see these same issues at other beaches, we’ll put restrictions on them too. If we continue to see issues, we’ll close our state beach parking lots entirely. RESTORE RI   We’re supporting Rhode Island small businesses with a new program called Restore RI, through which we will directly invest $100 million. $50 million of this money will be made available in grants of up to $15,000 as part of the first round of funding to provide direct cash assistance. These funds will help businesses facing reopening expenses such as plexiglass, cleaning supplies, and touchless pay technology, as well as fixed costs like rent and utilities. Yesterday I had a video conference with our congressional delegation to talk about how CARES Act funding will power this important program.   That money will both help business stay open and keep employees and customers safe. It is essential that this money reaches businesses in every part of the state as quickly as possible. Our team at Commerce is working around the clock to be able to make applications available in the next two weeks and to get you all the info you need to take part in Restore RI. If your businesses needs this support, you can prepare to apply by reviewing the details on CommerceRI.com or by calling 521-HELP.   REBUILDING RHODE ISLAND This week, I shared my vision for rebuilding Rhode Island's economy after the COVID-19 pandemic. We need to embrace what we’ve learned, and not just go back to the old way of doing business. The fundamental makeup of our economy has changed. We can't shy away from the hard truth that a lot of the jobs we've lost aren’t coming back.     But there's another truth that we can't turn a blind eye to either: the old way of doing business left a lot of people behind. Let’s address these inequities head-on, together. Let’s build a better, more equitable, more innovative economy. That requires making major investments in education, job training, small businesses, and housing. I’m excited to announce that I’ll be dedicating more than $200 million in federal stimulus funding to support these programs.  I hope you find this recap helpful. It's so important that everyone stay engaged and informed so that we can all stay safe and healthy. I'll be back on TV with more updates this week Wednesday at 1 p.m. We're all in this together. -Gina Raimondo Governor P.S.: Information is our greatest weapon in the fight against COVID-19, If you or someone you know wants to sign up to receive these emails, you can use this link. Governor's Office | 82 Smith Street, Providence, RI 02903 Unsubscribe  Update Profile | About Constant Contact Sent by communications@governor.ri.gov in collaboration with Try email marketing for free today!

subject: Can you make a donation today?
email_content: Less than 100 days from Election Day, our country is in crisis.The fight for social, racial, and economic justice has reached a new threshold. Coronavirus is raging out of control. Unemployment is at Great Depression levels. And Trump is unable to govern at even the most elementary level.But if we work together -- if we fight together -- if we persist together -- we can elect new leaders who will make decisions with compassion, common sense, and moral clarity.The next 100 days will decide what kind of country we build together. And earning people's votes takes time -- we need to be reaching out, person to person, right now, to make sure everyone makes their voice heard this November. Especially this year when more voters than ever will cast their ballots before November.So the next four days before our July fundraising deadline will decide what kind of investments we can make in grassroots organizing to win big across the country in the coming months.If we don't hit our goal by Friday, we won't have all the resources we need to keep growing our movement. If you're able to, please pitch in $2 or whatever makes sense right now -- it would make a real difference. the past month, alongside grassroots supporters like you, we've endorsed dozens more Democrats running across the country.These Warren Democrats will make us proud by fighting for the bold reforms we need at every level of government. But to elect them in 2020, we need to keep making serious investments in person-to-person organizing.This is our moment to build back our economy and our government better than ever before. So when our children and our grandchildren ask what we did to end one of the worst chapters in our nation's modern history, we can tell them we changed America.Grassroots supporters like you are the only people who can make it possible to win in 2020 and make big, structural change in 2021 and beyond.If you can, will you help hit this goal by Friday's fundraising deadline? for being a part of this,ElizabethDONATE NOW:  for by Warren Democrats____________________________________________All content © 2020 Warren Democrats, All Rights ReservedPO Box 171375, Boston, MA 02117____________________________________________This email was sent to .To unsubscribe, go to:

He directed and produced the film, 8 DAYS, to raise awareness about the reality of Sex Trafficking in the United States and is the founder of SHAREtogether, a non-profit organization fighting against the global crisis of Sex Trafficking. We talked about his story, what is happening with sex trafficking in America, and how to end it in our generation.Click the Blue Conversation Link button below, watch the interview, and email me with any of your thoughts.Check out more of what Jaco is doing and support his ministry by visiting sharetogethernow.orgBelow is a picture of Jaco and I at an event where I had the privilege to meet him. subject: The very first woman to represent NC-06 →
email_content: Quickly, I want to run some stats by you:A woman has never represented North Carolina's sixth district in the U.S. House of Representatives.Only six of the 333 people to represent North Carolina in the U.S.House have been women. Even though women make up more than 51% of the population, we have never had more than100 Democratic women serve at the same time in the U.S. House of Representatives.North Carolina got a "D" rating for women's representation in the state's government and politics. That's not OK.I founded Off the Sidelines, because I believe that when women have a seat at the decision-making table, we can make our country a better, more equitable place for everyone. I'm fighting to elect strong, progressive women up and down the ballot, and I couldn't be more excited to endorse and support Kathy as she runs to become the very first woman to represent North Carolina's 6th District in the House.Join me in supporting Kathy's campaign today → Kathy has lived in North Carolina's 6th for 30 years, and for 30 years, Kathy has made meaningful contributions to make her community a better place to live for all North Carolinians.As an immigration attorney and community leader, Kathy worked to ensure North Carolinians could afford to put food on the table and pay their bills. She fought to ensure everyone has an equal opportunity for strong education and jobs.And Kathy saw firsthand how devastating the astronomical cost of health care can be on a family when her daughter was diagnosed with a chronic illness and her insurance company told her it would cost her thousands of dollars out of pocket a month to keep her daughter healthy.There's no doubt in my mind -- we need someone with Kathy's personal and leadership experience in Congress. So if you are able, contribute today to make Kathy the very first woman to represent NC-06 in the House.Thank you,Senator Kirsten Gillibrand FOR BY KATHY MANNING FOR CONGRESS If you believe you received this message in error or wish to no longer receive email from us, please unsubscribe:

subject: The next Hurricane Harvey
email_content: Peter,Three years ago today, Hurricane Harvey made landfall in Texas, leading to floods that devastated communities across Texas. The response -- everyone coming together across our communities -- gave us all hope that real change was possible.It's a stark reminder, as we enter hurricane season in Texas, of why we need to set aggressive goals to fight climate change right now -- because if we wait, it's just going to keep getting worse. In 2008, I flew search and rescue missions in Galveston after Hurricane Ike, and I saw the devastation first-hand -- and just as Harvey was worse than Ike, the next big storm is going to be even more devastating than the last.Our biggest challenges require decisive leadership from those in positions of power. As we look at the crises facing our country, we just don't see that from Sen. Cornyn: Joking as a devastating pandemic kills thousands and leaves millions more unemployed in our state, taking zero action to face head-on the increasing threat of climate change, deflecting on pressing matters of policing and criminal justice reform and refusing to say plainly that Black lives matter.It's why I'm running for Senate -- but I need your help to win. Pitch in to help me bring bold leadership and real solutions to our biggest challenges to the Senate.>>>  can't afford six more years of Sen. Cornyn, and I'm counting on you to help me defeat him.-- MJDONATE:  clear we need a real leader for Texas and a Senate that prioritizes our health care. More than ever, we're relying on online fundraising to keep building the campaign we need to win in November, and we greatly appreciate your continued support >>  we know this is not an easy time for many. If you'd like to pause receiving fundraising emails for the next few weeks, please let us know here  We'll still keep in touch with important information and to ask your thoughts from time to time.----MJ Hegar was a member of the US Air Force and the Air National Guard. subject: Farmers for Scheller
email_content: LISA SCHELLER RELEASES SECOND COALITION TODAY “FARMERS FOR SCHELLER”FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASEBrooke Race Info@schellerforcongress.comAllentown, Pa. – Today, the Scheller Campaign is proud to announce its second coalition, Farmers for Scheller. Lisa Scheller strongly stands with farmers and the agriculture community and is eternally grateful for the hard work they do every day to put food on your table. Arland Schantz, chair of Farmers for Scheller, has been the owner and operator of Evergreen Farm, a hay, field crop, and evergreen tree farm since 1979. He has a seventh generation descendent to live on an operating the family farmArland released the following statement:“Lisa’s time on my farm was enhanced, as she was able to further become aware about the “Farm Programs”, as well as Issues & concerns farmers face, as they attempt to bring them to the attention of their Representatives in Government. It’s noteworthy to say Lisa demonstrated sincere interest in learning what farming is all about. It’s also noteworthy to add her interest and seriousness about being a voice for farmers. I’m inclined to trust that Lisa holds a sincere resolve to upholding the wellbeing of farmers, by working closely with farmers and actively addressing their needs.” JOIN FARMERS FOR SCHELLER TODAY < Paid for by Lisa Scheller for Congress, Inc.Unsubscribe <

subject: CNN Attacked an Innocent Student
email_content: Bill Olson for Congress Peter,My name is Bill Olson, and I am a conservative Christian combat vet who just overwhelmingly won my primary, by 20 points! I am the new Republican nominee, running to take back Florida’s competitive 9th District, currently held by Socialist Democrat Darren Soto. And I will stand shoulder to shoulder with President Trump as we fight far-Left Socialism! President has been telling us for years and years about the disgusting injustice of the media. They exist to tear the American people down, to promote their far-Left agenda.I truly believe many of them are evil people.But none of their antics are worse than what they did to Nick Sandmann, the Covington Catholic student a high school kid.The media, especially CNN and the Washington Post, immediately attacked this kid. They incited violence; death threats to him and his family forced the family to go into hiding and the school to close temporarily.In a word, these grown adults were trying to destroy this kid- to cancel him. This is what the far-Left media does.They lie, they destroy, they incite, and they do everything they ever can to avoid telling the truth.But they had never yet met the indomitable Nick Sandmann!Like a pro, Nick and his lawyers savaged CNN, the Washington Post, and two dozen other Fake News media outlets. While the exact amounts due to Sandmann are unknown, it is telling that Wikipedia now refers to Nick as the "owner of CNN"!I was in tears when I saw Sandmann speak at the Republican National Convention this week.      Image Sandmann, an 18-year-old graduate from Covington Catholic High School who was at the center of a nationwide viral video controversy, lambasted "cancel culture" in his speech to the Republican National Convention, calling on the country to join President Trump in calling the media out."I wouldn’t be canceled. I fought back hard to expose the media for what they did to me and won a personal victory. While much more must be done, I look forward to the day that the media returns to providing balanced, responsible and accountable news coverage," he said. "I know President Trump hopes for that too."He continued: "In November, I believe this country must unite around a president who calls the media out and refuses to allow them to create a narrative instead of reporting the facts. I believe we must join with a president who will challenge the media to return to objective journalism."Nick is now a freshman in college. And while he will be CNN's highest paid employee for many years, it took guts to come and speak out about our unethical attack dog media.      Image media are dedicated to the complete destruction of America, and they are equally devoted to the destruction of every single American who loves freedom and loves our country!Here's the good news: The American people see the media for what it is!A new poll released on Tuesday shows Americans have a growing distrust of the media, with an overwhelming majority saying the press have a political bias and nearly half saying news outlets display a "great deal" of bias.The poll noted an increase in the percentage of Americans who see too much bias in ostensibly objective reporting as a "major problem." According to the poll, 73 percent of Americans share that belief, up from 65 percent in 2017.Meanwhile, a stunning 84 percent of Americans agree that "the media is to blame for political division in this country," though the same percentage also believe the media "can serve as a healing force."Nearly nine out of ten Americans agree with Nick Sandmann about the faults of the media. But they only win if we let them!  That's why we MUST win this year!      Image an unapologetic patriot, unlike Joe Biden. Darren Soto sure as heck is not- he votes with Pelosi 93% of the time! He's a puppet of the extreme Left.This very week, Nancy Pelosi called us Republicans "enemies of the state". Knowing the history that led up to World War II, this should send chills down the spines of all Americans.But I have taken an oath to the Constitution- one that has no expiration date! I don't have crazy Pelosi's money, which is why I need your help to counter the media's lies! am calling all Trump patriots to help me to replace Socialist Darren Soto, and stand up for our freedoms as Americans! I am now the official Republican nominee, and I need your help to win in November!I need your help to stand up FOR the Constitution and AGAINST Communism! you help me? This is a swing district and we can take it back!Can I count on you for a donation today? I have a goal of $50,000 raised by the end of August to get on the air asap. subject: your weekly update
email_content: If you would like more information about how to slow and stop the spread of COVID-19, take a look at these resources from the Centers for Disease Control CDC.>>>  --We hope this email finds you and your loved ones safe and healthy. Our team is committed to sending these weekly updates to keep folks around Virginia up to date with what Mark Warner is focused on.Here's what Mark is working on right now:Last week, Mark met with residents of Harrisonburg, Virginia for a community check-up where Mark discussed how he is working to ease inequities across industries, including public health, education, and front line workers. Mark will continue to work to ensure all Virginians get the relief they need >>>  visited with community leaders in Abingdon to speak on the federal response to the coronavirus, expansion of broadband services for schools that are going virtual in the fall, and a greater need for telehealth services amid the pandemic >>>  course, he made time to stop by Skeeter's for their world famous hot dogs! >>>  visited Roanoke and the Blue Ridge Parkway to meet with tourism officials to discuss the Great Americans Outdoors Act. The bill will fund $1.1 billion in maintenance needs at Virginia National Parks and support as many as 10,000 jobs in Virginia >>>  a visit to downtown Lynchburg, Mark listened to the concerns of local leaders and organizers regarding broadband, CARES Act funding and unemployment benefits. Mark knows the importance of broadband in rural Virginia, and he will work with his colleagues in Washington to provide funding to support this essential service in the next CARES Act bill >>>  spoke with community leaders about the future of a post-COVID economy in Winchester as he toured the Emil & Grace Shihadeh Innovation Center. With 10% to 20% of jobs lost as a result of the pandemic, Mark is working on how he can assist the new workforce generation in a digital world >>>  discussed issues related to the coronavirus pandemic and small businesses in Woodstock, Virginia. During the discussion, he talked with community leaders about the next round of CARES Act funding, and how the pandemic has affected small businesses >>>  endorsed Dr. Cameron Webb, who is running for U.S. Congress in Virginia's 5th District. With his years of service to central Virginia, and his expertise as a doctor and a lawyer, his voice is one that is sorely needed in the halls of Congress >>>  a letter to prominent tech companies, Mark urged them to bridge the homework gap and help all Virginia students participate in distance learning this fall. As more educators and students prepare to go back to school virtually, Mark will continue to work to ensure virtual learning is equitable for all students in Virginia and across the country >>>  continued to press Postmaster General Louis DeJoy to answer for his attempts to weaken the U.S. Postal Service. Mark is doing everything in his power to ensure that all Virginians can count on USPS to deliver their medicine, pay their bills, and cast their ballots come November >>>  called on President Donald Trump to denounce his support of QAnon. With the release of the latest intelligence report detailing the Trump campaign's contact with Russian operatives during the 2016 presidential campaign, Mark will continue to work on the Senate Intelligence committee to keep foreign interference out of our elections >>>  you for your continued support.-- Team WarnerFriends of Mark Warner1490-5A Quarterpath Road #213Williamsburg, VA 23185PAID FOR BY FRIENDS OF MARK WARNER-------This email was sent to .To unsubscribe, go to:

subject: Happy Labor Day
email_content: Friends,Today is Labor Day, and for many of us, this weekend will be a time to enjoy friendship, family, beer, and BBQ.However, it’s also important that we remember Labor Day is a celebration of the blood and sweat shed by men and women across this country, who fought for fair working conditions, fair wages, and fair treatment.So while enjoying that hot dog or that union-made beer, I’ll also be reminded that it was a collective effort of working people around this country who came together to say: We will be treated fairly for the work we do.I hope you have a happy, healthy, and safe Labor Day and, if you know a union worker or local union organization, make sure to thank them for the important work that they do.Thank you,Josh subject: One step closer to saving the USPS
email_content: Huge news: we won our lawsuit to save the USPS.Here’s what that means:All election mail will be treated as First-Class Mail or Priority Mail Express.USPS will pre-approve all overtime pay for USPS employees between October 26 - November 6, 2020.USPS will submit a list of steps necessary to restore on-time First-Class Mail and Marketing Mail delivery service.Mail carriers will be allowed to make late and extra trips to facilitate the prompt delivery of election mail.The USPS will work under the surveillance of a federal monitor who will hold them accountable to their promises.In the midst of a global pandemic requiring more Americans to vote by mail than ever before, we are simply asking for a free and fair election. This is a huge step in the direction of ensuring the integrity of our elections.Thank you for your support so far. Now we need all hands on deck to get out the vote and elect the Biden/Harris ticket and Democrats up and down the ballot.Onward,MondaireWith this legal victory, Mondaire has already proven himself to be just the leader we need in Congress to fight for the integrity of our elections and the needs of working-class people — but we need your help to win in November.Help elect Mondaire to Congress by making a donation to our campaign today. subject: Time to Make Them Pay
email_content: Peter --I so badly wanted to see the Democrats come to their senses yesterday and finally vote to End Walz' Emergency Powers. But those radicals wouldn't even allow a vote on the resolution.Instead, yesterday's legislative session was full of Democrats politically posturing, claiming ownership of the real science and even mask shaming a female legislator.While countless Minnesotans like you and me are negatively impacted by Governor Walz' unilateral orders, Democrat politicians are hell bent on protecting their Party's governor.That means a line has been drawn!We're no longer encouraging you to contact your legislator and tell them to vote the right way. These Democrats have failed you now seven times. They refused to join five other Democrats and all Republicans with a little common sense. Now it's time to make them pay for voting against our liberties. The election is only three weeks away.Action 4 Liberty will be spending time, money and treasure over the next three weeks in these targeted districts, informing voters of what they did."Politician Brad Tabke voted against opening our economy seven times.""John Persell has Governor Walz' back, but not yours.""You can't count on Dan Wolgamott protecting your rights in St Paul."Peter, we are going to take this message to tens of thousands of voters in targeted districts from now until November 3rd. This will cost a lot of money, but that's what is needed to win this battle. Can I count on you for support? < < know a lot of candidates and organizations are asking you for money right now. But I can assure you that your donation to Action 4 Liberty will ABSOLUTELY deliver results on November 3rd.We know exactly which districts to target, who is the most vulnerable and using our model, can spend money more effectively than others. Your donation will change the dynamics of politics in this state.You've been there for us when we asked you to contact legislators. And that work led to five Democrats joining us think how hard that was to accomplish!. Unfortunately, the remaining targeted Democrats failed us and now we have to sort things out at the ballot box.
